title: No problems - set from bed
text:
To the folks who recently complain about multiple furnace screen - I don’t know what you did, but open up settings and it’s simple to correct. User error? 
We have really enjoyed our new thermostat and this app, installed about 4 years ago. Updates have been good. We've had no connectivity problems, and setting schedules and modifying is straigh simple. It can be set to adjust to outside temps too instead of just time of day. (You can set it to reach the temps you like AT the time you like knowing Sensi will actually turn furnace on sooner and full speed if its really cold out, and closer to the schedule time if it’s only cool out.)  I LOVE being able to control our furnace from bed - turning it  up early if I wake early, or down if we want to sleep in later than usual. We have even used it from the airport to be sure we returned to a toasty house. I thought our old programable thermostat was fine, but I would never go back now as this system allows much more flexibility for saving energy while you’re sleeping or at work, while still keeping you comfortable. A solid app. We have not tried the beta location app that adjusts temp down 3 degrees if your phone leaves, and turns on as you near home... we keep a pretty predictable schedule and just overuse that if it’s an odd day.

title: Went SO downhill!
text:
When I got my first Sensi about 1-1/2 yrs ago I was thrilled, especially with the app. Sadly, there's very little great in the tech world that psychopathic designers and programmers can't ruin. The app used to be simple and perfect--open it to a full screen view of your thermostat; and control changes stuck. Now, it first opens to a crippled small list view of "all" your thermostats--because most people have five or six right? </sarcasm> You can change temperature up or down on the dinky view, but have to press to then get the full screen version for things like on/off heat/cool or fan. I use the app a lot as a remote to change fan on/auto so now have to navigate every time to do this--so damned annoying. Also, it used to solidly accept control changes now those are super flaky and often don't stick. I just tried going up from 68 to 72 and had to try several times because it bounced back to 70 then down again to 71. Many times it doesn't stick and send to device after closing app and you have to go back.

I used to praise this device to anyone any everyone. Now it is just another piece of annoying crap tech that barely works and is designed by psychotics with no clue.

title: Bad outdoor temp data prematurely triggers dual fuel systems to burn gas
text: I have 3 Sensi’s and have been relatively happy with them until recently when we noticed the outdoor temps are WAY OFF at night.   Before this we had to replace one in less than a year and have some connectivity issues with another. But the issue I have now is two fold – where they source their weather data from us not accurate for my rural location, and currently Sensi settings are not flexible enough to allow us to change the source or add a local source (we have a lacrosse weather station) for weather temp data. This is essential for those of us with dual fuel heat pumps. We learned that Dark Sky (recently bought by Apple and claims to have the most accurate hyper local weather data lol) provides the weather data for these Sensis.  But from dusk to dawn they report my outdoor temp 8 degrees cooler than it really is, causing my heat pump to kick over to propane and unnecessarily burn fuel instead of the electric heat pump. Do that every day thru winter and the costs add up, making the dual fuel setup almost useless. We love our sensi’s but if they don’t either give us more flexibility / control to change data sources OR find a more accurate data provider, we will be going to Nest or some brand that provides the options we need.  I’m not going to let their ‘auto switching to aux’ destroy my fuel bill.

title: Works as Advertised
text: The WiFi functionality was up and running in about 10 minutes. Very easy if the directions are followed. I love all of the advanced settings related to heat cycles, geofencing, and sensitivity of thermostat. Already I notice that my furnace isn’t running nearly as much this winter and my home is still at desired temps. The only issue I have was that when ordering my new thermostat, the Sensi was advertised as one of the few smart thermostats that “doesn’t need a c-wire” to replace older thermostats. This is a tad misleading. Although you don’t need a dedicated c-wire, your wire configuration has to be altered if you don’t have one. The installation walk-through on the app never addresses this. I installed per the app and furnace wouldn’t turn on. After an hour I luckily found a tutorial video on the app that showed how to use the “fan” wire as the c-wire. This worked, but you lose the ability to use the fan to circulate air. All in all, I love the thermostat and app, but wish the c-wire comparability would have been communicated better. Lots of people are replacing older thermostats that do not have more than 4 wires.

title: Honest review from a rational person.
text: I’ll start by saying I got my thermostat free from my local municipality. If the thermostat you’re replacing is an old ‘set it and forget it’ wall dial this will be a huge upgrade. I’m not going to get in-depth with its features other than to say you can control this thermostat with your smartphone anywhere on the planet as long as your thermostat has connectivity to your home wi-if. Now with that said, in regards to connectivity issues voiced in other reviews; yes, it will occasionally lose connection to your home wi-fi. I’m not a network expert. I can’t explain why. I can understand how this immediately throws people into a tizzy. It’s been my experience however that if you just let it be it reconnects itself automatically, usually in less than a couple of minutes. Your experience may vary, again I’m not a network expert. It doesn’t happen often enough though for me to warrant immediately panning it (‘one star!!! This things garbage’). I’d say 95% of the time it opens immediately on my phone. It’s a small gripe for me and the specificity you have in setting heating and cooling schedules outweigh it. Now for the big gripe. After you sign up for this app the your junk mailbox will increase by 40+ messages a day.  No joke. Nothing is ‘free’ I guess. Be warned.

title: Sensi ST55 WiFi Thernostat
text:
This is the second unit I have installed in a separate house. I have had Honeywell and Nest units before. Although the Honeywell models are highly accurate and dependable, I find the Sensi from Emerson to be the best unit I have ever used. It has a very good setup tutorial through the App. It guides you step by step from start to finish. The thermostat is very intuitive and logical in its operation, and this is most likely due to the engineering thought process that was a part of its background.
The App is refreshingly simply in its layout. What I have found over time is that technical support by phone is superb, probably one of the best among any company I have ever dealt with. They have always been able to assist me and solve my owner-induced issues. I am happy as well overtime with the fact that they have not made drastic changes to the App-this can be frustrating with other Apps as you have to relearn a system-this is not the case with the Sensi App. If someone were to ask, this is the only thermostat I would recommend.
Well done Emerson with your Sensi product!

title: Best thermostat. Period.
text:
I’ve used all the major brands. Some at higher price points and some lower. Many have claims of being the best and mostly those are exactly that; claims. 
I’ve actually used scientific recording devices and data on the last three homes we’ve had. I can honestly say that they are the best. They keep the temperatures very constant and the features of being able to circulate the air without having the heat pump or AC on is great. We also like the geofencing and easy installation and programming   (We have friends that I fear for them with a screwdriver, and have been able to use the tutorial and successfully install it themselves without my assistance- helpful as we’re 1000’s of miles away now!). 
We’ve never had any issues and would never use anything else. I might also add that Emerson is known for their best in class process controls, so this device quality comes as no surprise. (And NO I don’t work for Emerson!) :)

title: It’s…okay
text:
So the thermostat itself is fine, no issues with the wiring or buttons, looks nice, simple design, whatever. but oh my god. the app. talk about a working nightmare. first, it disconnects from the internet spontaneously throughout the day. no network issue, has been reset multiple times. still continues to fail. secondly, don’t even waste your time making day groups and schedules. something called “peak time savings daily energy efficiency optimization” will consistently override them. i understand the thought process behind it, but there should at least be a way to turn that off. why even bother with a schedule when a program will just do whatever it wants. and lastly, we have two of these thermostats for different levels in our home. the first one turns off immediately after the temperature changes to what it’s set at. but the second one will continue to run for 10-15 minutes after it’s been turned off. even with countless tinkering and trying everything, there is a HUGE delay. overall, it’s fine. i guess.

edit; i’m changing my review from 2 stars to 1. since the newest update i can no longer keep it connected to our wifi. basically worthless now. should’ve just gotten a nest.

title: Great!
text: I think the app and thermostat works great. I can adjust the AC or heat from anywhere; bed, on the way home early from work, on vacation, etc. it has worked flawlessly no matter what situation. It is more reliable than my WiFi. I don’t understand what you people are complaining about having to do an “extra step” to access your thermostat....it’s right there, all you have to do is bump the temp up or down. If you have to switch from AC to heat or to turn the fan on, is it really that big of a deal? It literally takes less than half a second to select your thermostat and go to the next menu. I like having all of the thermostats listed. I have a business that’s 25,000 sqft with 4 ACs....makes it a breeze to see them all on one screen and check the temps on the fly. Lets me know if there are any problems and if they are working correctly. Plus the option to “lock” the thermostats to prevent anyone tampering with them is a major win over the Honeywell thermostats.

title: EXTREMELY PLEASED!!!
text:
Although getting a complete overhaul of our existing Heat/AC unit was a bit pricey, I can tell you that having chosen Sensi was one of the BEST DECISIONS my Husband & I have ever made. It's extremely user friendly & the updates you've recently been doing have only improved the performance & boosted my opinion. The geofencing addition is sooooo helpful in our daily lives where we're so busy it's one less thing to worry about when leaving the house. I thought being able to log in while away from your home was perfect, but now having it automatically update the temperature to your specifications is just brilliant. 
   I'm NOT one to leave comments on the App Store (I think I've only ever done this 2x in all the years I've had my cell) but I wanted to give a big shout out to this company for outstanding customer service & a brilliant working system.

title: Needs IFTTT App Interface
text:
I like the Sensi app but here are the ways you can improve it:

1. Please make an IFTTT plugin to allow decisions to be made based in the IFTTT app. For instance: I want to be able to have IFTTT monitor indoor humidity and either turn on a smart plug connected to a humidifier if too low or, if too high, run the AC to dehumidify the air.

2. Please give us access to our temperature and humidity data (all of it) so I can compare it with outside ambient conditions and see how HVAC equipment is responding.  If you can’t give use the data then allow IFTTT to collect it (to see and record current set point, temperature, humidity, and usage  data from the thermostat).   It would be nice if we could download this data along with our set points and runtimes on an hourly basis.  This would help people like me make better decisions about what to set my thermostat to given the weather conditions or even the weather forecast, to save energy without sacrificing comfort.

title: Sensi Twin’s
text:
Upper and main floor Sensi thermostat’s have been a pleasant addition to our home.  

During lunch at work I was able to review and alter settings via internet or cellular connection.  This led me to discover several cool features like fan circulation, switch from heat to cooling, fan on continuous or system off.  

This is a very helpful tool during service and or troubleshooting. Case in point was Service Tech arrived before scheduled appointment and I was able to engage a/c units remotely so they could hear the subject noise concerns outside.  

One on vacation would benefit from Sensi to see real-time HVAC condition within the dwelling to adjust if desired. 

I would like to offer a suggestion to incorporate humility adjustments via Sensi application. Maybe an upgraded humistat can talk with an upgraded Sensi to make these adjustments. If so, really would have liked to have been educated by salesperson of this option.  

Cost now would prohibit us being able to afford four (4) additional Sensi and Aprilaire thermo and humidity stats.  

We are very satisfied with the operation and yields of pleasure from Sensi we have.  

Thanks

title: UPDATE: Works great if you are not visually disabled.
text:
Well I’ll be darned, 24 hours after writing this review it appears the issues have been fixed! THANK YOU! But still only 4 stars for TAKING SO LONG

Original recent review:
We bought two of these 1.5 years ago and had high hopes. My wife is blind and uses Apple Products extensively due to Apple OS VoiceOver feature. Unfortunately that relies on app developers testing against the voiceover API, and the Sensi developers apparently paid no heed to that. There are a numbers of quirks but the show stopper is the app refuses to announce the current temp setting. Well no problem I thought I will just report it, which I did... 1.5 years ago. The response was it was “in progress”. Uh huh... still waiting. Methinks it was a smokescreen and there is no intention to address voiceover Interface. We are now looking for a different solution.

title: Cheap smart thermostat
text: It does what it should and works the big three smart home systems, Homekit, Google and Alexa. However, getting it working with Homekit was WAY more than I'd bargained for. For some reason, homekit support requires it to be hard wired to a power line from your hvac system to work. Strangely, the other smart home systems do not require this. This caused much consternation and me eventually fiddling with rewiring my hvac system slightly to accommodate it. To be fair, I have no idea if competing products may require the same, but somehow I doubt it. Also, I bought a new Wi-Fi router and changed my network name and updating This device also proved more difficult than it should have been. So much so that I tried and gave up for several days before trying again and eventually succeeding with help of laptop instead of my iPhone. If you're technical and cheap, might be OK but be warned.

title: Good but needs these enhancements
text:
I’ve had this for years and love that the developers are actively improving this product. Here are a couple of enhancements I’d like to see added to the backlog. 

Time to Temp: Okay copying this one from Nest but shouldn’t be too hard to calculate with usage history or if you ask about home details sq/ft etc and calculate it that way. 

Fan Timer: More control over the fan. Being able to turn on for say 30 minutes or 1 hour rather than just on/off/auto would be a really nice to have. I often manually turn it on and forget to turn it off for hours. 

Usage Reports: One enhancement you could make to the graphs are to scale them for 24 hours per day and then fill in the blue for the hours actually used. That way if the AC is on from 1pm to 3pm I could clearly see that data rather than just a total summary of hours used over the 24 hour period.

Cycle Speed Control: I know you can set this to slow medium etc but I rather be able to control the degrees. For example I set to cool 72 it doesn’t need to come on at 72.1 I can allow a 2 degree swing. So wait until 74 before kicking. This allows more control, less wear and tear on the equipment and energy savings. Old Honeywell had this feature so does ecobee.

title: No problem ... until it goes wild to 60F/15C with a BUG
text:
I have have Sensi installed since last fall.  It had been working flawlessly, until it’s summer and I was ready to switch it from heat to cooling.  I am now getting a wild ride!

Turned on cooling, it adds a “OEP” or “Smart Home Rate” schedule in the cooling section.  Inside it, in a few hours it creates a day group for the current day, while all other days in the week are in a separate group.  You wouldn’t care about this, except that the single-day group goes to 15c (60f)!!!

We woke up at night because the AC is working so hard and it’s getting so cold!  I turned off the thermostat, restarted, and deleted the single day group, and overnight the 15c (60f) magic comes back!  After multiple tries, now I have to turn off the system before going to bed.  What a nightmare!  I happen to have two Sensi thermostats for two floor level, and both dance the same tune.  How frustrating!

title: Great thermostat but want stronger UI options
text: This thermostat delivers. It’s cheaper than the competition - great if you don’t have a c wire. The battery life is incredible as the supplement power source. Made me realize I did not need to waste the extra $$ on a Nest. BUT I feel the Sensi app falls short on delivering options for control in the user interface. The geofence idea is great but I I’d like more manual control. Why doesn’t this app provide a direct “away” button that you preset to the desired away temperature and hit when you’re leaving the house. Then hit it when you’re about to return? Same goes for a “vacation” button. I have set an option as a separate schedule that I use when I leave for vacations but the way to get there within the sensi app takes many steps which is sub par UX. Other thermostats offer that like the Eco Bee and it seems Sensi thermostats have the infrastructure to offer that too.

title: Thermostat Operation is inconsistent!
text: Let me start by saying that I don’t take a 2 star review lightly.  I’ve pretty much rated all of my purchases at 5 stars due to the fact that I only purchase products after investigating what others say and based on proven performance.  When the thermostat is working, I love it!  Unfortunately it can’t seem to stay connected to not only my google home account, but also to its own app.  I’ve had it for around 4 months now and my monthly reports don’t show for any of them since it is offline so much.  When you spend over one hundred dollars on something, it’s very disappointing to have so much trouble from it.  I’m an HVAC tech so I’ve done my research and made sure everything is perfect for compatibility.  There doesn’t seem to be anything I can do that will resolve my problem.  If I found a solution I would gladly change my review.

title: Love this app and thermostat!
text: My husband and I just moved into a new house and the first upgrade on my list was a wifi thermostat. We had a Nest at our old house and it worked fine, but I didn’t want to spend that much again, especially since we have 2 thermostats in this house. After much deliberation, we decided on the Sensi wifi (not touch screen). I absolutely love it! While the thermostat itself isn’t as eye-catching as the Nest was, I love the app so much more than the Nest app. I love that I can set multiple schedules for each setting (cool, heat, both). I go out of town frequently, so all I have to do is set it to the vacation schedule and I’m good to go! I’m so glad that I chose this thermostat!

title: Overview
text: When the utility offered to install for free I was not particularly interested , didnt see the need for WiFi thermostat. Now that it’s been in use for a month I really like the convenience if use. I’m truly impressed , not one issue with the install of either the unit or the app. Both installs were simple and worked from startup. The thermostat was included in an inspection of my home to upgrade my energy usage. I didn’t use the programming feature because being retired I’m not on a fixed schedule. Now I simply reach for my phone , even while lying in bed and change the settings. So without much effort I can affect my energy bill in a positive way. Great unit.

title: Was good until about a year ago
text:
It’s my 3rd winter using this app. The first two were great! Never had any problems, and the app worked as expected. However this winter so far has been dismal! Whatever they did in the updates over the past year has created many bugs. The app is really flaky now w hard to pin down bugs.

 One recurring issue is the delay that happens sometimes when you manually change the temp. You click the up arrow a few times and you see no change... so you click a few more times, the about 15 seconds later you see the temp went up double if what you wanted. 

Another issue is the current schedule disappears every once in a while (doesn’t display down at the bottom). I can’t get it to show again, so I just manually set the temp. Then the next morning I find the heat is turned completely off.

Another ... if I manually change the temp within 30 or so mins before a scheduled changes, it sometimes skips the scheduled change.

Would be great if I could revert back to the app version from last year... I really never had any issues.

title: Recent Changes Make App Terrible
text: I used to love this app. This was one of those rare apps you never had a problem or issue with, it just always worked. And it worked perfectly. Since they changed the app in the last 1-2 weeks, now when I open it instead of connecting immediately, it always shows a “Connecting...” message and it can take 10, 20, sometimes 30 seconds to connect. Absolutely nothing has changed on my end, so it had to be changes made to the app. Also, I’ve noticed when my furnace is running now, it’ll show on the app that it’s not. That’s annoying, too. Disappointed considering how well this app worked before they ruined it.

title: Terrible bug - Can disable an iPhone
text: When trying to connect to wifi, this app can prevent you from using your iPhone almost completely. You can’t swipe up to quit the app, and you can’t get past your lock screen or get the exit/Emergency Call (SOS) screen to appear so you can swipe to shut down. However, it WILL allow you to make an Emergency SOS call (unintentionally) with the side power button! Nothing you do with your thermostat including trying to reset the wifi or turning off the ac/furnace or even removing the batteries will be of any help. The only thing you can do is an obscure procedure to restart the iPhone—press volume up briefly, volume down briefly, then hold power button for many (10?) seconds until the screen goes black and the Apple logo appears. Then delete the Sensi app and reinstall to clear any corrupted settings that might have caused the problem.

title: Sensi WiFi Thermostat
text: I have had my Sensi WiFi Thermostat for 3 years now. It worked beautifully without issue up until the last couple months. I can’t keep my thermostat connected to WiFi. I’ve tried everything I can think of and what support pages have suggested. I don’t know if this was triggered by an app update or not but since I haven’t changed things on my end, I have to assume it’s app related. Most of the time my thermostat shows a full connection but the app frequently shows a failed connection or worse yet doesn’t actual do what I’m asking it to do even though the app screen shows it follows the commands. For example turning off my AC from the app only to find it hasn’t actually turned anything off costing me money. I have read the other recent reviews and see I’m not the only one experiencing these issues. Please fix whatever went wrong so we can all get back to loving your product again.

title: Nice. Room for improvement.
text:
I’ve had 2 Sensi thermostats in my lake house for about a year now. They have worked flawlessly except for one minor detail. You can’t have both in the same wireless network. They will connect and appear to work fine, but one would lose connection some time later. I have more than one wireless network, so I was able to fix that issue by connecting to different networks. Since putting on different networks, they have worked flawlessly. 
Hookup can be complicated depending on your wiring situation, but most DIYers should be able to follow the in app directions. 
Suggestion to dev. Put humidity on the main screen. I’d like to know what it is at a glance.

title: Good Almost Great
text:
Have enjoyed the simplicity and reliability of the thermostat. Recent updates to change from Heat, Cool, or Auto have been very welcomed additions. Now starting to get monthly basic reports on usage. That is where the thermostat could be great..... if the information on usage was more detailed to include breakdown of daily usage with hour detail. I have not used geofencing this far, because I would not want the temperature to change in the house when I leave, if my wife is still at home. Maybe if possible to trigger the geofencing when both our phones move outside the 4 mile range? 
Some of these ideas might be more than some people need, but would be nice to have the option. Would still highly recommend the thermostat!

title: Update is awful
text:
With the new update, harder to navigate. The app is now slow to respond. Have to redo it over to get it to kick on and run. Hard to get to schedule screen now. Before it was supper easy to click on and do changes. Now since the update take forever to get it to open up on the schedule page and then if you change the times either it does not change or it takes minutes to change. Before it was a couple of clicks and the changes were set up and ready to go. I loved this app and thermostat before this and had it for a year. Now I hate it and am looking into replacing it and going with a different company. Very let down and frustrated. Such a disappointment
Change it back so I can love it again quick before I replace it with someone else’s product. .

title: App works well.  Thermostat works well.
text:
We use three Sensi thermostats to control three different buildings on a zoo campus and they all work very well over the Zoo’s Wi-Fi system.

We even had a heater that was a little finicky and sometimes would lock out because it’s in a dusty area.  By using the app to turn the thermostat off and on we were able to reboot the heaters computer and turn get it to turn on at 2 am in the morning. That saved us a emergency repair call in the next day were able to clean heater.  

The cloud service been reliable And we are going on our second year of operation in a  pretty harsh environment. 

We have three Sensi‘s and one wifi thermostat of another brand.  We will be adding two more Sensi’s thermostats in the future to our account. While the app updated the color scheme, which for me are less pleasant that is a very minor issue as everything is still easy to read and access.   

If I could ask for a few features, it will be customizable temperature and humidity Alerts and an remote temperature probe.

title: Generally very nice app and thermostat
text: Have had this thermostat for a couple of years now in our summer home. It is nice to have the place cooled off when we get there. Never had an issue connecting until a couple of weeks ago. Started receiving a message saying that it could not connect to the Sensi cloud. After much digging around and resetting everything, even though everything looked fine, the issue ended up being the app on my iPhone had to be upgraded. I did that and presto-I can again connect to the Sensi cloud. So, this was a useless error message which caused unnecessary poking around and resetting things, when a simple message like ‘upgrade your app’ would have done the trick. Also, as others have mentioned, the cycle time is too short. Otherwise, a nice product.

title: I was excited for update. It promised to fix schedule retention
text: We were completely satisfied when we first bought this thermostat. It worked beautifully for the first year.   Then when the cold came this fall/winter, I realized it wasn’t retaining the schedule edits I would make, so I was manually adjusting temp. The app did help a little since I could make the changes from my warm bed.   I was excited when the most recent update claimed to have fixed this issue but nope!  It saved the first edit I made to the weekday schedule but when I edited the weekend schedule it appeared to retain the change but when it was time to get up this morning the house was cold. The edit had not actually been saved. We will be buying a different thermostat and will NOT be recommending the Sensi to anyone. Too bad because a couple of years ago, we were completely satisfied.

title: Great Start...
text:
The app does what is expected.  It allows me to remotely control my thermostat when away from home and also control it using a voice assistant.  Due to a recall, I received a new thermostat from Emerson and was delighted to see that it supported HomeKit as my first generation Sensi dit not.

Setting it up was a pain as HomeKit would never see the new thermostat.  After several attempts and a hard reset on the new thermostat if finally connected.  Since then, it has worked without any issues.

CONS:

One, the app is not universal.  If you are using an iPad and want to look at the thermostat, you either have to grab your phone or rely on the scaled version of the phone app.  Not a deal breaker, because you can use Siri for most things.

Two, those of use with only a single thermostat shouldn't have to tap the small tile on the opening screen of the app to get to a full view of the device.   I understand the need for this screen for those with multiple thermostats, but it seems like there should be a way to automatically open a default one.

I'd love to give the app 5 stars, but this one falls just short.

title: I can no longer trust it
text:
These last few updates have been a problem for me. Whenever I want to adjust the temperature or simply turn off my furnace, the app only seems to work about 30% of the time. Very frustrating to come back hours later to find none of my settings even took. So much for saving me $. What good is a WiFi thermostat if I can't control it remotely?!

Update: The app never works when I want it to. Now probably only about 10% of the time. The other 90% it shows “offline”. My WiFi is 150mbps and I stream to 3 TV’s and 2 laptops simultaneously without issue so no that’s not the problem. If there was an option for zero stars, that would be more appropriate in my case. It’s taking every fiber of my being to keep from ripping the unit off the wall and drop-kicking it into the road for someone to run over. Thankfully I’ll be moving soon and the new owner can deal with it.

title: Great Thermostat and Great App
text: I don’t know why anyone would give anything less that 5 stars for the App let alone the Thermostat. Ours has worked flawlessly and is the most convenient app I’ve ever used. We can’t sleep when it’s too hot or too cold so if you forget to adjust your temperature before bed no need to get up,  it’s easily done with the App or you can  program a schedule to heat or cool at a time of your choosing. How can you not see the value in that? If your having issues you might want to make sure you’ve wired the connections correctly and make sure you’ve connected to your Wi-Fi correctly.

title: Great Device
text:
I highly recommend this device. Easy to install and gives you the convenience of controlling your home climate wherever you are. I typically wake up and adjust my thermostat from bed with my phone.  If my kids schedule change no matter where I am I can ensure the home is warm before they get there.  Or if they leave we all know they’re not concerned with cost heating/cooling the home so I adjust with my phone based on their whereabouts. I have friends who own a place at the beach. This device allows them the ability to have their unit warmed or cooled prior to getting there.  

It pays for itself in a short period of time.

title: Sensi
text: This WiFi programmable thermostat is very easy to use, setup was actually pretty quick if you are already familiar with programmable thermostats. It was very easy to replace my existing one. Once you download the sensi app it walks you through step by step. It only took about 20 minutes to install and setup. I love being able to change the temp by the use of my phone. Great product with a very nice look. The only con about it for me was not really an issue with the functionality of it at all but the outside diameter of the thermostat is smaller than my old one, thus exposing the old paint color on our wall. The actual screen display itself is a little larger than our old one so that’s a plus.

title: Pretty bad
text:
The thermostat doesn't consistently actually sync to what I set on my phone and will often disconnect from my phone while I am trying to use it. It's nonsensical. I set a schedule, but for some reason the temperature right now disregards it completely and says it's set to 78°. Again, it's nonsensical. It looks like the app was reskinned but still is just as bad as before.

How this has anything other than a flat 1-star rating is beyond me...I assume it’s cheaper to hire people to fake an Apple store review score than to fix the app, because that’s the only thing that makes sense to me. If it were possible, I’d rate this zero.

Edit: After they responded to my review, I did contact support regarding my issue complete with a recording of the bug happening. Their response was essentially that the problem exists and there is no fix. Also, no planned fix. I’ll probably buy a nest soon.

title: Sensi: great experience & reliable!
text:
I had a great experience with Sensi thermostats and this iPhone app on two systems in an 90s house that had mechanical mercury thermostats and no C wire.  I would remotely monitor and adjust settings all the time.  Rarely did the settings fail to transmit from app to my home thermostat.  

Well, one of those older systems died and I ended up replacing it with a top-of-the-line Carrier Infinity multispeed AC that required using Carrier’s MyInfinity Touch thermostat and associate iPhone app.  What a mistake!  You can go read the reviews for that app.  Take heed.  And be very happy if you can use a Sensi thermostat!  It’s a great experience.

title: Love it!
text: I have two of these in my home.  I think it’s the most underrated smart thermostat on the market. HomeKit compatibility is a big plus and the main reason I bought this over the Nest. I bought an Ecobee and kept it for a month before returning it. The ecobee had a very cheap feel and the touch screen was not very sensitive.  The Sensi touch screen requires a very light touch, similar to an iPhone. The app is also very easy to use and the Alexa integration is wonderful. You can set the mode and temperature with voice commands. After one year I have absolutely no complaints!

title: Very happy
text: I ordered two for an upstairs and down stairs unit.  Work flawlessly.  Use them to shut my air conditioning off during peak on demand hours between 3pm and 8pm in the Phoenix AZ area. I am on track to save almost $1500 on electricity this year.  Plus I received a $30 rebate for each unit from my energy provider APS.  My only recommendation for improvement would be an option to program times in 5 minute instead of 15 minute increments.  And also easier access to monthly AC usage data.  Installed them myself.  I have the “C” wire.  Very easy.  Change your WiFi to the 2.5 ghz on your phone prior to pairing the thermostats.

title: Great and getting better
text: I purchased a couple of these four or five years ago. They have been fantastic ever since I got them. One is for a property I have to take care of 300 miles away, and the other is for our home. Since he is constantly improving them. Definitely a worthwhile investment. am used to having a counter that shows how long the system has been running so that I have a filter alert. In today’s day and age it seems that would be a standard feature any high-end thermostat. Other than that, this is a fantastic unit.

title: Easy Peasy, just buy it!
text: I have purchased two of these WiFi Thermostats and both work like charms.  They are not hard to install, the instructions are clearly written and it works exactly the way you want it to every time.  The first one was purchased two years ago. When we bought a second home I knew exactly what to buy again.  I have recommended this model to my family and they all report the same experience.  I am more than happy to recommend a well built product that works great every time!

title: Excited to disappointed in just a day...
text:
We tried to give this thermostat a chance. It initially seemed ok and we were very excited. Sadly in just a day and a half it’s decided that it doesn’t want to try to follow the programmed schedule. Several times I have had to open up the schedule to get it to kick in. It will be blasting heat when it shouldn’t be, like it’s decided we should have our home 5-6 degrees hotter than we programmed it. It’s not in a cool space either. It’s smack dab in the center of our home so it’s not getting a draft. 

We reset it and had trouble reconnecting it. It finally worked after 3-4 tried and we reset it again. At this point we are close to just returning it and getting something less finicky. It would not connect to home kit, however. 

Also, it says we can add multiple phones for geofencing but after searching through the app we have not been able to find this feature. When you are using the programmed schedule you have to manually switch to geofencing, which is a bit of a pain. I wish this were automatic. 

Overall this thermostat was cheaper but I guess you get what you pay for.

title: Worth the money easy to install
text: I have truly enjoyed this thermostat I also have it to where I can tell Alexa to turn AC up or down or off or heat on amd it also shows on the app when to replace filter how much energy you have used IE shows heat pump hrs back up electric furnace hrs AC hours and fan circulation. If I had to do it all over I’d buy this again amd again over the other smart thermostats. Simple to install walls you through step by step. If your thinking of getting a smart home thermostat this is the one I would suggest to anyone to buy

title: Keep loosing wifi connection to home network!
text: The thermostat/App periodically looses connection to home Wireless Access Point when there’s nothing wrong with the home network! Sensi gives you no mean to know where the problem is! 10 out of 10 it’s their STUPID cloud server that drops off service without warning and they give you NO indication via the App or else to troubleshoot it! Most times, it comes back on its own and at times you have to go through the painful process of manually connecting. This morning for the last 2 hours wasting my time no luck! This is not good. Most my friends who have Nest thermostat have nothing to say, but praise and here, I’ve been going through this problem just too many times since I have bought this piece of junk!

title: Difficult and clumsy
text:
Often says it has gotten disconnected when it’s not clear whether it has been or not.  Never clear what you need to do to get it cooling again— most times it gets to that point again by itself but who knows how.  Often times the house is more than 5 degrees warmer than the temperature to which you have it set— sometimes you get an e-mail or text pointing this out, but not always, and again, without any real remedy. They just ask you to make sure you didn’t leave a door open (No, Sensi, I didn’t).

It may be that the Las Vegas simmer heat is too much for even this new, state-of-the art A/C system to keep up with, but often there is no problem, and I can’t tell even or why my thermostat will help me combat the heat successfully or not.

title: Great thermostat
text: I have been so happy with the purchase of my Sensi thermostat . I had it on the wall for months, yet it  wasn’t  until my recent vacation that I really appreciated the ability to adjust and change temperature whether I needed heat or AC and I always knew what was going on back at home over 600 miles away . I was sure  I made the right decision  . Also I did a lot of research , this thermostat compliments the decor in my home . I found the other choices to be unflattering in appearance whether they were black , grey , or whatever . The Emerson Sensi is just the best looker of the bunch by far ! Thank you !

title: Extremely pleased!
text:
I extensively researched several different “smart“ thermostats. I have to say I could not be more pleased with my decision to go with the Sensi thermostat. It is so nice to be able to adjust the AC or furnace from anywhere even from the comfort of my own bed, it really is nice in the summertime to be able to turn the AC down simply by picking up my phone or hollering @ Alexa...I also really enjoy the lock out feature that way my teenagers can’t pretend like they’re in charge! RUGRATS!

One development suggestion:  Add a scheduling feature for the fan ...That way I can simply circulate air at intervals throughout the day without turning on the power hungry furnace and/or AC unit...

title: Great when it works
text: Love it when it works, which is most of the time. But for some reason it goes offline for no apparent reason. It does appear back online some time later. Is that how it works? Or am I missing something? As far as I know, I can’t seem to find any owner/user manual that I could reference to try to figure it out. I have two of these Sensi thermostats. The one I have the most issues with is the one literally 10-12’ away from my modem/router that is the latest that my provider offers (Xfinity X1). Both thermostats have new batteries. I welcome any feedback. Thank you.

title: Power outage disconnect
text: I installed this today and loved it - until we had a 10 second power outage. Once the router came back up, I received an error on the thermostat that wifi was connected, but not connected to sensi network. There is no fix for this except physically removing the face from the base plate for 30 seconds after the router comes back up to reset it. I bought this to monitor my vacation home when we are not there. Tomorrow I will purchase a battery backup for the router to see if it helps. If you are around, this is a great, versatile smart thermostat.

title: Wonderful
text: It just works. Making the schedule is easy. And allows many schedules to adapt to our family where we both work different schedules and home/away/sleeping happens at all hours. Plus, my initial thought is that my electric bill may be noticeably lower due to the ease of making schedules that are so adaptable. The app does it all and makes it easy! My only complaint, and reason for one lower star, is that when power goes out, when it comes on it takes it awhile (20ish minutes) to come around to reading the correct temp in the house.

title: Sensi T stat
text:
I bought this from a person whom was told he could not use this with his system and I was told by a different installer they will not hook up WiFi Controls and also said it would not work with mine but I’m pretty stubborn and read the instructions and it works great and give all types of warning which came in real handy as I added a dehumidifier and house is cooler ac bill is down and programming from my phone is pretty cool and very fast. I love it and bought one for my garage also, it works great too!
Thank you for a great reasonably price unit that work great!

title: Maddening. App fails frequently.
text:
The thermostat works great. However, if you make the mistake of becoming accustomed to using the app to control the thermostat, you will be met with the app failing frequently and requiring all kinds of “re-setup” with your WiFi. Plan on spending large amounts of time removing batteries from your thermostat and generally standing in front of it re-installing it every few months. To make it worse, after doing all this you may find out their servers are down and it will not work without their cloud service which will mean you have gone through all the “re-installation” for nothing. Finally, when the app goes down, you have to be physically in front of your thermostat to fix it. 
Generally, most the time I just want to chunk this device out into my front yard.

title: One complaint
text: We have this in our condo in Branson that we rent nightly through VRBO. We loved that we can control it 5 hours away and if I was to rate it yesterday morning I would have give it 5 stars. But yesterday evening my renter called and said it was 76 degrees and when trying to adjust it, the setting went back to 85. I found later that a stupid update put auto settings in that I didn’t program. My friend who put the thermostat in led me over the phone how to turn the automatic settings off but the update put a bad taste in my mouth for this brand.

title: Great app for HVAC System!
text: I have been very impressed with the Sensi app and thermostats since they were installed with our new HVAC systems a few years ago.  Su easy to use and set schedules. Also easy to manipulate temps if you want a boost of hot or cold differing from scheduled temp setting. I also love the fact that I can manage my thermostat from anywhere in the world. Makes it so nice if I forgot to turn things down or up when on a trip or to prepare for a group coming back to the house when I want a specific temp. Great app!

title: Only ONE complaint...
text:
I am 100% pleased with so much about this. 

But, as so many others have noted, MANY of us wish that the fan could automatically be kept running while the A/C or heater cycles as needed. Yes, we can manually switch the fan to ON, but why make us do that?

We already have a multi-point schedule for temperature. So simply add a "Fan On Override" option at each schedule event. That would completely solve everyone's needs, and it would fit right in with the existing UI and operation.

title: Great product!
text: Sen / si thermostat was simple to install. I did have to go into the attic to attach the blue common wire but it is so worth it. I love the look and features of the thermostats. We purchased two, one for upstairs and one for downstairs. And the phone app works excellent! Tip: if you have strange things happening with the thermostat, clean the surface with regular rubbing alcohol and it will solve ghost commands from happening. The touch screen is excellent and sensitive so cleaning it makes it work perfectly!!! Highly recommend this product!

title: Very pleased
text:
We have never had a smart thermostat but we are hooked for life.   The convenience and multiple features are fantastic.  So far we have found it to be extremely accurate and easy to use.  
We have not used all the features as yet but expect them to perform as well as those we have already used. 
If we were asked, we would highly recommend this thermostat.
We were away recently and controlled our home temperature from our phones. So amazing!

title: Never a problem
text: I don’t know what you people are talking about, I have never had a problem with this. The app works perfectly, the thermostat works great Very straightforward and easy to use. I think you all should check your Wi-Fi Internet connection. That’s where most problems occur. The monthly report is very useful. But when your Wi-Fi goes down, it will revert to original settings that you pre-programmed. When your Wi-Fi does go down it takes about 15 to 20 minutes to go back online because it uses the cloud.

title: I will be forced to buy a different thermostat
text: We picked the Sensi over other comparable thermostats after lengthy research. I would give it 0 stars if it was an option. We were sold a defective unit that keeps resetting. 30 day return policy from Emerson, also 30 day return policy from ComEd marketplace where we bought it from.  We didn’t even get it installed until the 30 day mark. We were questioned, and they insisted pictures of the wiring at the thermostat and at the furnace. Were told “the many calls we get about this problem is a problem with the C wire at the furnace”......My husband is a supervising electrician that specializes in energy management for commercial computer controlled HVAC and refrigeration systems... think he can wire a home thermostat.

title: Pretty good app
text:
I bought a Sensi smart thermostat and have been really happy with it. The app is pretty good as I can set up schedules to heat/cool the house plus I can access the app to make slight adjustments if the house is a bit too hot or cold. This has been super convenient!

I wish there was a way to shut down the heater or cooler at the end of a cycle rather than shut it off abruptly. When I turn off the ac it makes a loud sound. It would seem better for the AC to shut down in a different way? Not sure if that’s correct but at least the app responds quickly! ;)

title: Works as expected
text: I bought to control the heat in my polebarn. Remote monitoring temp. Remote ability to adjust heat. It also tracks the heating unit’s on time. It also warns you when if the heat drops several degrees quickly, like you left a door open and if it drops below the low temp limit which is 45°f.  If I had a wish list is the would adjust the firmware to go to 35 degrees for the outbuilding. I now turn the unit off, and rely on a second mechanical thermostat to protect the building from freezing. Doug

title: Restart delay
text: I have complained many times and requested many times that Sensi do something about the short cycle times even when the unit is placed on the slowest setting. My air-conditioner cannot take this being on for 10 minutes off for seven minutes 24 hours a day. I feel as though it is being damaged by the short cycle times and have not been happy with it since the original purchase due to that also the heat cycle closes my air handler to shut down because it’s too hot when it restarts

title: Poor performance
text:
This app started off great, for about 2 years. Then the problems started. 

Among other things, the app insists the humidity level in my house is 99%, and keeps sending me warning emails. That’s ludicrous, of course, but there is no way to delete the humidity setting and start fresh. The humidity offset doesn’t work at all, but even if it did, offsetting by the max 25% wouldn’t come close to the true humidity measurement.

The schedules once set, cannot be deleted. There are simple instructions to delete schedules. The problem is the app ignores those instructions and repeatedly says an active schedule cannot be deleted. Even though the schedule function is turned off, and that schedule is not active. When selecting “delete” next to that schedule, the error message comes up again and again.

I’ve deleted the app and acknowledged that I understand all the data will be deleted, too. Then when I reload the app, all the old data and the 99% humidity setting is still there.

My only option is to delete this problematic app permanently.

title: Easy to install and great to be in control.
text:
I would give it 5 stars, but there was a few weeks it kept losing connection to WiFi.  I reset and it worked for an hour then stopped working again.
I reached out to Emerson and they told me how to reset, which was what I had already tried.
I didn’t have time to fuss with it and it’s working again.  Not sure what changed, but no issues at all now.
Very accurate readings and the times we had our floors pressure washed, I got the high humidity warning.  I would still recommend!

title: Still Bill
text:
My Sensi thermostat (model#UP500W) wont stay connected to WiFi. I have a Xfinity Cisco Telephone/Router modem (model#DPC3939).Sometimes the Sensi connects to WiFi and then disconnects. Other times I tap the App and it just shows offline.  And when it’s connected to WiFi and somewhat functional it doesn’t accurately maintain the set temperature. I give it 2 stars because it was free thru a rebate program from my power company DTE Energy here in southeastern Michigan. 
Yeah, I follow the help procedure and disconnect the battery. But that got old real quick. I’m always hopping that the fix is in the next App. Still waiting. Still Bill

title: App frequently freezes
text:
Installed device and app yesterday. Thermostat works well. Having trouble with app freezing. Did it while scheduling, another time when teaching my wife how to use app and another time when checking to see if device followed the schedule.
This morning I opened the app and it continually searched for the connection. In each case I turned off the iPhone to reset app and app worked when phone came back on.
Device connected to phone - no hub or HomeKit in house.
Am I doing something wrong?

title: Awesome.
text:
I can't believe how simple this was to set up my Sensi Thermostat. The app walks you right through the installation, connected to my network with a single Gliche.  My systems an older system and does not have a C-Wire.  
Unbelievably simple.  I would love to see it link with apple home kit. That would be even better.
Only downside is...with all the features and options, it won’t tell when to change your furnace filter.  How easy would they be to integrate mark the app. Hard to believe.

title: Good App but Lacks Basic Features
text:
The app should allow to share the control of a thermostat with other user accounts like it can be done with Ring or Nest or other Smart device companies. The way it is now is very inconvenient. I would not recommend this product to anyone when a basic feature like that is not yet included.

When tried to provide feedback through the app, using the Leave Feedback button under the Account Information, it doesn’t work. When try to send the feedback, it’s says Error, Please enter a valid email account???

title: Seems very good!
text: I haven’t had my thermostat long and my HVAC company has to come back because my heat won’t come on since I think they wired it wrong but it is running my AC here in Florida very well. I would like to see one change though and that is if the wording that says humidity and shows the percentage could be made bigger on the app and even on the thermostat screen. I need to run and get my glasses In order to read that. The degrees show nice and big so why can’t the humidity be a little bigger? It’s not as if there isn’t any room on my phone screen in the app or the thermostat screen.

title: Stat
text: I’ve had my sensi stat for about 6 years In our vacation home that was 5 hours away. It was nice to monitor house from away. Could turn heat up when traveling there or kick on the a/c when out on the boat in summer. If there’s a problem sensi will send you an email and give monthly reports. Now we live full time at vacation home. And it’s still nice to check on house while traveling. I’m retired hyacinth tech. And this is best stat for the money. I’ve put them in all my friends homes.

title: Happy
text: Sensi thank you so much for the wonderful innovation with the touch screen Wi-Fi update. First day with my new SENSI and I’m in love with it. So easy to install and the videos were so helpful, so I gave myself the opportunity to also update the 4 wires thermostat and replaced it with the 5 wires connecting the C wire as recommended. Little bit tedious but worth the money. I was really looking forward for the next generation of thermostat and I found you. Thank you again and again. Truly amazing experience. Sincerely your new happy customer Sal.

title: Sensi Smart Thermostat
text: I’m not really sure what to rate it yet because I’m not 100% positive I have it wired or configured correctly. One thing I’m sure of is that the directions leave a lot to be desired and their support is terrible. I’ve sent 2 or 3 emails to their support going back a couple of weeks and have not received anything back yet. I also called and after being on hold for 1 hour and 3 minutes I had to hang up. The person that mans their Twitter site has been very helpful otherwise the support has been horrible. If I’d known that the support was this bad I would have bought something else. So buy at your own risk.

title: More bugs added
text: I’ve had this thermostat since 2015. The latest app update has given me nothing but trouble. I open the app and it states the thermostat is Offline when it is Online. The wifi symbol on the thermostat shows it is connected. Sensi’s fix is to force quit the app and relaunch. That doesn’t work after several attempts so look on their website to see if they have server issues. Nope, server is running ok. Very disappointed with Sensi’s support. SENSI - fix your latest app. Runs worse than ever.

title: Does what I want it to do
text: I have a Nest in one home but it keeps changing itself and I got tired changing it back. This one does exactly what I program it to do and it maintains the temp perfectly for my elderly mom. The screen is big, easy to read and the up/down arrows are easy for mom to see and adjust with her fingers despite the arthritis. I love it! Setup was a bit complicated. But I followed the directions and on-screen and app prompts. It all worked. Now it’s easy.

title: Scheduling
text: First off let me say that the thermostat works perfectly. The reason for the 4 stars is because there is no off timer or on timer. When I want to setup a schedule to turn the system off and back on at a certain time it can’t. I live in Arizona and in the summer it get HOT. My Electric  provider has Peak hours as well as off peak hours so on the HIGH PEAK HOURS I thought I would setup a schedule to turn off the thermostat at 3pm and back on at 6pm but guess what can’t. So please Sensi make this option for me. Thank you

title: Very Happy with my Sensi
text: I bought this thermostat at Home Depot April 2018. I had a couple of issues when I was installing the app connecting to the Sensi WiFi. I called customer service and they walked me through the issue promptly. Once the app was installed, it is very easy to use. I love enjoying the comfort of programming my cooling zones from the phone! Enjoying programming my AC an hour before I wake up so the house is not freezing cold when I wake up! Enjoying the freedom, comfort, and easiness of programming my AC from an app in my phone! Thank you!!!

title: Missing one setting.
text: I really wish there was a way to set a temperature range. For example if I set my thermostat to 75 I would like to have the option to let the temperature rise to 76 before it kicks on and run the temperature down to 74 before it shuts off. This would prevent the AC unit from turning on and off so much which is not good for the unit or your power bill. I’ve had my unit turn on run for a minute or two just because the thermostat went to 76 and then as soon as it showed 75 turned back off again. I feel like this is prematurely going to wear my unit out.

title: SENSI - Easy to use
text: We have been using Sensi for our Church heating and cooling needs in three zones. It has worked well for us over all. Sensi works off a Weekly programming calendar. What I would like, is the ability to schedule changes in advance on a Monthly or even Annual calendar. Having to make changes for an upcoming Tuesday event, forces me to make the change after the current Tuesday, and then change the schedule back for the next Tuesday afterward. When schedules change, it can make for a lot of work.

title: Pretty Good !
text: Once set up, it seems to work flawlessly. Have had it over a year now. Setup was somewhat difficult with just the provided instructions and we had no phone service at the time to call for help. Be aware that if you have multiple thermostats the one you setup LAST will be on top of your list, so our basement is on top. We cannot find a way to change that without starting all over and we live 5 hours away. Otherwise, we would have given Sensi 5 stars.

title: So convenient
text: When there are 4 people with 4 different ideas of ‘comfortable’ it’s nice to be able to control ‘affordable’ temperature ranges from my phone even when I’m away.  And when you’re laying in bed and it’s just toooooo hot? Grab your phone (it’s right there next to you) and lower the temp! Installation was simple, just check you’re existing wiring before you purchase a specific model. Older homes like ours don’t always have the grounding wire.

title: Great but for one thing
text: We have a lot of windows across from the thermostat.  In the bright light I cannot see the display at all unless I am two feet in front of the display. When I touch the thermostat it brightens up enough to see it across the room. I would like the option to leave it at that setting.  I hope someone reads this who can make it happen. I know there are two display levels. I have it on its highest level.

title: Horrible! Keeps dropping Wi-Fi constantly!
text: I’ve tried everything under the sun and it keeps dropping multiple times a day.  So incredibly annoying.   Customer service just keeps asking me a million questions what kind of furnace do you have what kind of router do you have blah blah, everything I have is pretty new within just a couple years even my entire furnace. We have strong Wi-Fi, etc. And they will not replace it or send me a new one or anything. This is the worst thermostat in history!

title: Good product, great value
text: We like the new Sensi thermostats.  We bought 2, one for each of our AC units. Wasn’t easy to install, but diligently following the directions got us hooked up and ready in about an hour.  I like it well but about every other day the upstairs thermostat doesn’t work.  It just goes off line for about 2 hours and then magically come back online.   It keeps the temperature steady even while it’s offline so it doesn’t cause a big problem.  The bottom thermostat works great. For this reason I can’t give it a 5 Star. I gave a 4 Star.

title: Awesome product
text: Love my Sensi smart thermostat! I’ve been using it and the app for a little over a year now with absolutely no flaws! I always forget to adjust the temp whenever I leave for a trip and now I can do it while 1,100 miles away with a simple couple clicks. Also really rely on the app when there is a bad storm because if the app is still connected to my thermostat I know I still have power and don’t have to rush home.

title: Emerson - Sensi smart thermostat
text: I needed to buy two smart thermostats, so I did some research. I was really impressed with the reviews and the ease of installing the units. So I went ahead and purchased two units and I have to say that it was very easy to install and navigate through the program and to set up the bear is scheduled. The only thing that I recommend is that there be a note on the jumper cable that it is automatically installed and no need to do anything. That threw me off a little bit but once I got the air

title: Decent product
text:
But to be honest do you really need it? The old thermostats with 7 day cycle and multiple change of temp times worked fine for me. Now if you do not have a regular day, getting up, going to sleep at seriously variable hours, often being out of town then this will be great. You can adjust your home temp from the airport so it is nice and comfy when you get home.

For most of us that is a rare occurrence and not something I would have considered a problem needing solving hence the 3 star rating. The software has worked fine.

title: A great product!
text: This is an awesome product! My husband & I would argue over the temperature of the house and for real! That was the only thing we argued about! 😂 having the ability to control the temp when your away is great! We can turn the AC down while we are gone and then set it to start cooling an hour before we get home is great! And the savings has been amazing! You should definitely get this if you are looking into thermostats!

title: Can’t log in
text: I have been using Sensi Thermostat for about three years and this morning I am asked to log in. Forgot password sends you a temporary password but once you go to screen to change password it won’t recognize the temporary one it just sent. Not sure what happened to my original password I’ve had all these years. TOO MUCH SECURITY ON EVERYTHING. TOO MANY UPDATES. If something works, leave it alone. If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it or fiddle with it. Now I’m on a long hold waiting on tech support. Was a great app. I will give 5 stars once I can use it a long time with no problems. I am sick of all the 2 step verification processes. I DO NOT want to keep verifying my information.

title: Weather controlled
text: I replaced a 15-20 year old programmable thermostat that worked fine because this one could be “locked” at the thermostat and is controlled through an app on our smart phones.  My son who lives with us kept changing the setting from what we wanted while we were at work. But I was surprised that it switches between heat and cool automatically once it’s set up and here in Michigan, in the Spring it can be hot one day and cold the next. Very pleased as my old one need manual switching.

title: Great
text:
I’ve always wanted a remote way of controlling my shop heater so I could pre-warm the building BEFORE going out there in the winter.  The Sensi fills the bill.  It also reports humidity which is handy when doing finishes on pieces I’m doing.

It took a little wiring to get a ‘C’ wire, but using the heater wiring diagram and replacing the original R/W wiring with a 4 wire I was able to add what was needed.  (It’s ok - I’m and engineer.)  Bonus is I can also run the system fan in manual to get some air motion in summer.

title: Very bad!
text: These reviews must be bogus. I’ve had sensi thermostat for about 2 years and it has been a literal nightmare!! I change the temp via the app and the thermostat doesn’t change. Most times connection drops, they have issues with servers. Once I had to run to buy a replacement thermostat at 2 am because this one stopped working and locked me out. So many bad things to say about this bad app...take your time to really read these reviews from people that give honest reviews.

title: So far very satisfying
text: We chose this brand because pretty much they all seem the same but all the reviews showed customer service was superior here so that’s why we chose it. Hook up seem pretty easy and straightforward. We have a place on the river and we generally leave and leave the thermostat at 79° and then it takes till the next day to cool down we get there. The last few visits I’ve adjusted the thermostat the night before we get there and it works perfect.

title: The smart thermostat keeps going offline after first battery change
text: I followed all of the directions in the app, and the Sensi keeps going off-line. It is getting to be very irritating. The batteries were dead, and I replaced them as the app described. Then I had to reconnect to the Wi-Fi. It works sometimes, and then it just drops out sometimes, even if the Wi-Fi is working. I think it has to do with something in the Sensi but I am not sure yet, and I have not ruled out that perhaps the newly replaced Wi-Fi router in the house could be the issue. But we have good Wi-Fi and everything else, and the Sensi shows that we have good Wi-Fi, but at the end of the day it’s just not working.

title: Love it. Better than other popular brands.
text:
I bought this thermostat through my electric company. I put it in one of my rentals. I now like this one more than my Echobee that is in my house, and it cost 3x more than this one. 

Very easy to use with self explanatory features. It has features that I wouldn't normally use, but since it's so easy to program, I went ahead and took advantage of and setup. 

Don't let it's lower price make you think it's not a great product. I love it.

title: Ruined a great product but Sensi is trying
text:
Since the facelift, the app is more difficult to use, showing inconsistent temperature between screens.  I have been patiently hoping the updates will turn the corner and bring back the functionality we had before when it actually worked even it did not look fancy.

Update: many of the issues seem to have been fixed. Credits to Emerson that the app is again quick and stable.

title: The best!
text:
Our Sensi thermostat has been serving us well for several years. The programming options are almost unlimited. The smart phone app is super, and the convenience is awesome. The built-in step by step guide to installation makes it easy - it’s amazing. 

Unlike Honeywells, the temperature swing, outside the temperature setting, is adjustable on the Sensi. Unlike Nest, the price is very reasonable. 

Reliable, easy to read and use, and good-looking. We picked the white unit, which looks great.

title: Not living up to its potential
text: It works fine. But there is so much more that could be added so easily that would make it amazing. You should be able change the temperature and say when you want it to return to schedule. IE: Hold temp for 5 hours. Instead of just having to wait until your next scheduled time. Also, being able to set up a temporary schedule that overrides your set schedule would be very handy on days where you aren't going though your normal routine. These are all things that could be added to the app and not have to tinker with the unit.

title: Works for me!
text: I live in the Midwest. Cold winters here. I cannot rave enough about my Sensei. I turn the heat up or down so effortlessly when at home via the app. I was out of town for 10 days and set the heat at 60 degrees, periodically checking the app. Sure enough, 60 degrees steady. Then when I was 30 miles from home I bumped the temp up to 69. By the time I got home the house was at a cozy 67 and within minutes up to 69. One of the best “gadgets” I’ve ever purchased!

title: I love this app
text:
It is such a pleasure to be able to adjust the temperature in the house while watching TV at night.  The app is particularly helpful when we go out of town and I forget to set the thermostat on the vacation schedule.  When we land at our home airport, I can easily reset to our normal temp settings. 

I wish Sensi had a Apple Watch app. Since I wear my watch while in bed to monitor my sleep; it would be nice to be able to adjust the thermostat if needed, without getting out of bed.

title: Great Product A+
text: I was skeptical about this product but have been very pleased and satisfied with the ease of use. I have the non-digital product because I was fearful of not having any buttons… I started with one and now I have three. The app is very simple and allows you to schedule and turn off/on from anywhere you have internet. App speaks to all three units and is very easy to operate. Cheers to a great thermostat!

title: I loved this app and would have rated it five stars, until...
text:
Now, every time I open it, the damned app wants to send me push notifications. They cannot be turned off. 

No, I don’t want push notifications. No, I don’t want push notifications. No, I don’t want push notifications. No, I don’t want push notifications. No, I don’t want push notifications. No, I don’t want push notifications.

Please fix this! Thank you.

title: Option to turn ON fan in cycle mode
text: I have an Ecobee thermostat in my other house and it has option to set the fan to turn on and cycle for few minutes. This would be a nice feature to add to Sensi thermostat which currently have option to only turn it on continuously or off.  Very useful when you just wanted to circulate the air intermittently and not running the fan in continuous mode.

title: Much Improved!
text:
Emerson has substantially improved the functionality and usability of the SENSI app since my review 2 years ago. (Current version 4.5.0 as of Jan 2019).  

The easy up/down control of multiple thermostats on the home screen is very useful. The detailed configuration of each thermostat remains much as it was designed several years ago. The editing of multiple schedules is a bit confusing for some of my family. 

I would like some visual indication that the temperature setting was manually adjusted, and an estimated time before the thermostat returns to the programmed schedule. (I think a manual adjustment overrides the programmed value for 2 hours.)

The geofence setback feature works well, but I would like an ability to set the range to something other than 3 miles. Additionally, I would like geofencing to work in conjunction with the programmed schedule.

title: Extremely unreliable
text: I’ve had this thermostat for close to 3 years now and it’s beyond frustrating. You buy a WiFi thermostat to be able to control it over WiFi anytime you want, not 50% of the time. You open it up and think it accepts your changes only to find out minutes later nothing happened. My WiFi is literally 6’ from the thermostat, but constantly goes from strong signal to off-line and it’s a roll of the dice on if it’ll work when I need it. Tried resetting it, reinstalling it, reprogramming it.... nothing helps. Buy a Nest, I know I will be.

title: Great thermostat
text: Got the Sensi thermostats to be able to control the house temperature remotely and it does just that... easy setup and no issues so far after almost a year.......I actually have 2 AC systems in my house and have the ST75 touch screen stat controlling most of the house with the ST55 controlling the addition ...they work off the same app... Sensi also makes trim plate if the new stat is smaller the the one being replaced... I needed one for the ST55....I highly recommend both of the thermostat.

title: Good but can use an enhancement.
text: I have used Sensi for a couple years. It works well but they can add an improvement that can make it better. Currently it can work off of programming or geofencing. I really like geofencing, but since I'm home at night the temp stays the same. During winter, if I am using geofencing I have to manually turn the temp down at bed time and turn it up when waking. I don't like it hot when I sleep and waste energy keeping it warm. If Sensi were to add the function to use programming while home and geofencing when leaving and coming home it would be great!

title: Connecting the dots!
text: I have to honest I had never installed a thermostat  and with my new thermostat this was an upgrade. The instructions were clear and the videos were beneficial and can be useful to anyone. I am happy I made this purchase while it also completed my home since everything else is Bluetooth and accessible via an app. Great product and Process has been amazing.

title: Great stat!
text:
This was so easy to install !!!
It seems that every other Device that that needed to paired with WiFi would take 3 or 4 tries before it  recognized my WiFi ! I was all set in 2 minutes with this product 
And the wiring was just as easy ! I had one question that there customer support answered right away !!
Love it so much my sister is buying four of them for her house for me to install !!!!!

title: Sensi thermostats and software
text: Wow, this is a great product! Very easy to install and configure, now we have the convenience of being able to change the heat and air-conditioning settings from anywhere. One of the thermostats needed a little tweaking - Called customer service and was back in business in about five minutes. Very efficient! We are extremely happy with the purchase

title: Great Product
text: I installed the Sensi wi-fi thermostat in our second home in another state.  From my smartphone 1200 miles away I am able to adjust the settings, monitor the temperature inside and out and the inside humidity.  We are saving electricity and heating gas by keeping the summer temp high and winter temp lower than otherwise if it could not be monitored and adjusted.  Best of all we set it to a comfortable setting 12 hours before we travel there and arrive to a comfortable home!

title: Embarrassing for Apple - Had to Use KINDLE FIRE to connect
text:
Two iPads and one iPhone couldn’t get this to connect to HomeKit.  All I needed to do as a competent person was be able to manually key the network info, but it was militant about me using the dumbed-down auto mechanism which failed repeatedly.

Finally, I tried my son’s Kindle Fire Tablet - designed to be cheap and simple, and I got it to work in less than two minutes.  If I can setup my network in iOS settings manually, how about letting me set it up manually in the app?  

That said, once I successfully set it up with Amazon’s spectacular ;) tablet I was able to add my registration info to the iOS app and operate it like I was supposed to.

title: Way better than Honeywell
text: Before this I had a Honeywell Lyric that was terrible. It’d takes 15+ minutes to set up WiFi, which would need to be redone a week later when it forgot. I switched to the Sensi Touch and love it. By comparison I set this thermostat up in roughly a minute. The app is well-done, simple, and reliable. I wish it would give data on how often it’s calling for heat, but I expect that feature to show up eventually.

title: Nearly perfect app
text: The app works really well and connects to the thermostat almost instantly. My only complaint is that when I change the temperature setting it goes into a “hold” mode that temporarily overrides the Schedule. This makes no sense and it led to my AC being left in after my electric rates had gone up dramatically on my time of use plan. This hold mode should not exist at all or should be able to be turned off in the settings.

title: I love everything about it but would like to see one improvement
text:
The set up and connectivity is a snap and it’s easy to install. The video takes you through step by step and the customer service is outstanding.

The ONE thing I’d like to see is the display change on my iPad or iPhone. The current temperature is giant sized but the set point temperature is so small I need to put glasses onto see it. If it was a bit bigger it would be a lot easier to use.

Would I buy it again? Heck yes!

title: Happy with smart technology
text: Just started using in past two days. Love WiFi version for monitoring and can lock settings from app. Will probably update this review as I experience more from living with a smart thermostat. The options of thermostats to choose from is endless. We found this choice to be good as far as performance and price for what you get.

title: App is inconsistent
text: The thermostat works great, but the problem is controlling it with the app.  I can be sitting 5 ft from the thermostat and the app won’t turn my furnace/AC on or off.
