It will adjust the temperature most of the time, but also goes offline a lot and the WiFi router is in the same room.  The main reason for getting it was to adjust my thermostat when I’m away so I don’t waste money with it heating/cooling all day.  It appears to adjust on the app, but when I get home it hasn’t. So it’s great when it works

title: Battery
text:
The Sensi is a decent thermostat but the battery causes issues with losing WiFi. Even with 1/2 showing on the meter, it shuts off WiFi and remote sensing is lost. It doesn’t specifically say it shut off WiFi so it takes a bit to diagnose. 
If I had it to do over, get the Nest!  Much better user interface, auto set back when leaving and better diagnostics make it a better choice for not a lot more money. I didn’t need the bells and whistles at this location so I figured saving $50 was the right thing to do. Wrong choice!

title: App is great, Please increase the temp swing.
text: I like everything about the app and almost everything about the thermostat. My lone complaint: the Cycle Rate setting does not allow for a large enough temperature swing. On slow, the thermostat still switches back on before the thermostat registers a full degree below the set point, which results in the hvac cycling on/off too often. My simple suggestion: allow the user to determine the temperature swing as opposed to the current slow/medium/fast options. I would like the option, for example, to choose a temperature swing of a full degree or two above and below the set temp.

title: 3 months in...  good so far
text: We will be using this from a distance.  Recently our power went out (while we were at home) for 3-5 minutes so the modem router had to reboot. Sensi came back onto WiFi by itself. I didn’t think it was able to do that. Time will tell on that aspect of it. Also very A+ good that it tells us the humidity level inside the home.

title: Useful app upgrades
text: With each upgrade useful features are becoming available. The feature I liked best about this thermostat is that I would be able to lock the thermostat on my phone so that the kids cannot play with it this last upgrade is even better because my teenagersCannot keep changing the thermostat passed a specific preset. Good work guys

title: SENSI Review
text: I love the fact of being able to know that I can forget to turn my AC/Heat system up or down manually when leaving the house and being able to control it with my phone anywhere anytime. Also, when lying in bed, I don’t have to walk to the other side of house to manually turn system up or down. What a great easy to use app. Thank you!

title: Super stable, excellent customer service
text: I’ve been using the model 500 thermostat for several years, and when all my other WiFi connected devices have connection stability issues, my Sensi thermostat and app *always* work. The two times I’ve called them for help, they had intelligent, really patient people help me out. It was like the good old days before all customer service calls were routed overseas!

title: 3 years of use
text: Went for Sensi as an alternative to nest. Works well but the change between programmed schedule is cumbersome. We use 2 Sensi thermostats and they  appear offline most of the time so you will have to try multiple times -sometimes this takes hours- to access the schedule and change it. Also, there should be a way to apply the same schedule on both devices... not the most intuitive or reliable software.

title: This app is very buggy with little good support
text: It was a bear hooking this up on my iPhone. I needed help. Then it went offline. We got it back online but it went offline again,  which I’ve not been able to recover from. The examples the app gave under help was for a different thermostat. When I called for help the guy told me I had to do all kinds of reconfigurations on my router, which I’m not qualified to do and frankly don’t think I need. I’m now stuck until the guy comes back!

title: Remote control of house temp
text: I like having the ability to control house temperature features of the thermostat when I’m not at home. Also, I can adjust the temperature in the sleeping spaces in the middle of the night (we live near Phoenix), particularly in the summer months, without getting out of bed. And, setting and adjusting the thermostat on schedules is easy. All-in-all, a great tool for keeping your home at the right temperature at the right time.

title: Safety Notice
text: i keep getting Safety Notices and yet when I call customer support I do NOT get any help. I was told to take place pictures of the back of my 5 devices - all if which are on the list of devices which have a recall - and after I emailed this information I have not even received an acknowledgement that Emerson/SENSI have received the info I was requested to send them - why is that?? er

title: This is so flexible
text: With two houses to control, Sensi allows me to set summer and winter schedules for both. I can monitor energy usage every month and make changes depending on season and how many people are in each house from anywhere in the world. When we arrive at the summer house, it is very comfortable since I turned the air on before we even got in the car.

title: Bought 5 of these so far
text: These Honeywell thermostats with Sensi are great.  Sensi manages all 5 thermostats on one account seamlessly. I open it up and can easily edit the schedule on any of the 5. We have 2 of the thermostats in our home. When we built a building on our property a couple of years later, the a/c guy had planned to install a different brand of smart thermostat, but we insisted that the new thermostats have Sensi. I highly recommend it!

title: Works great!
text: Works flawlessly. I got one for upstairs and one for downstairs and they’re both controlled right from the app. Cool features that alert you if the temp isn’t reaching the goal within a couple hours so you can check your equipment. Battery’s last a long time. I’ve had these for 2 years now and they still show a full battery even though my wiring doesn’t have a hot wire to run the thermostat

title: Works for my home and cabin 330 miles away.
text: I installed the first one in my home a few years ago with great success. 3 years ago I installed an electric heater and same thermostat as in my house. Set it up internet app easily and both are online. I can turn on the heat or set temperature for freezing days from home. I recommended this product to several friends.

title: The best
text: We’ve had this for about 2 years now and I must say...they back their product 100%. The unit stopped communicating with the router and tech support not only worked me through the problem but they send me another thermostat with a WiFi point specifically for the thermostat. I will absolutely buy another in the future to upgrade to the new one but this product is solid and so is the App.

title: Needs More Features
text: For the price I paid, I had expected more features to be included in this WiFi connected device.  Pairing was initially confusing and difficult, but with the latest software update, it appears to have improved. AVS features using Alexa are very limited, but still convenient. The monthly reports are a good start, but more data (heating degree days, average lows, average highs? OA RH, etc are needed. Integration with an add on AccuRite sensor would be great. Schedule editing should be easier.

title: Great Product
text: We have been using the thermostat for years - we sign in remotely and the app shows my humidity levels which is very important in my location and sends me a monthly report on my heating/air conditioning usage.  We also installed the thermostat ourselves- had great instructions and they made it very easy.  Can’t say enough good this about this thermostat!

title: Flakey but it works ok
text:
This app does nothing more than every other thermostat can do. Basic stuff. Have asked for YEARS that they keep track of how many hours a say it runs.  OR open up the firmware so other programs can’t work with the data.   Crickets.  So, we settle for average.

They DID fix something recently though.  Now, whenever they update, it doesn’t log you out.  Who remembers their thermostat password???   Fixed now, it seems. Added a star for that.

title: Intermittent. Worrisome
text: Well I thought this device was great till it dropped the network today.  I had made zero changes and the Tstat is only about 10 feet from the wifi router.  I’ve had it installed about 2 weeks in a seasonal home where I had hoped to monitor and adjust the temps and humidity remotely.   Not so sure now.   To reconnect the tstat I had to be physically present at the device.  This is disappointing and I have no confidence that I will be able to monitor and stay connected for several months while I am away. No other smart devices on my home grid had any issues.

title: Works as expected. Not fancy.
text:
I replaced my Ecobee 3 with this Sensi unit as part of another HVAV system called Ecovent.

I simply replaced the old thermostat by wiring in this one. Adding it to my existing network was easy. 

Getting the Ecovent controller setup was easy too. The Ecovent App does everything for me via their app. I don’t need to set a schedule with this, given that the Ecovent app takes care of it.

However, I like having this as a back up. I wish the Sensi app itself was iPad ready. It’s not, and that’s my biggest disappointment. Using the iPhone app on my iPad is a sub experience, but the iPad does offer more screen real estate that the app could take advantage of. 

The app it's does what it supposed to do. I can set temps, I can set schedules, and I can control this if I’m away from home.

Never used the previous versions of the app so I can’t comment there.

title: Simplifies my life
text: Very easy to install if you have even the basic of skills. The Sensi app works flawlessly.  When I am away from my house I set the AC to 80° and when I’m getting ready to come home I turn it down to 76 so that it is nice and cool when I arrive.  I paired it with my Alexa echo and can just give commands to set at whatever temperature I want.  Well worth the money.

title: Sensi thermostat
text: Best addition I’ve done. My old digital thermostat would have to be kept at 72 to keep our house warm in the winters. I’ve noticed our Sensi is now kept at 65!  Better technology, better sensors and I can control it all on my phone over WiFi. It also works when the WiFi is out by simply using the touch screen thermostat on our wall

title: Sensi is an amazing thermostat app
text: We have a very limited wifi data plan and almost no cell signal where we live. When we are gone the thermostat reverts to 50 degrees when we come home we use the app to raise the temp an hour before arrival and furnace fires up heating the house to whatever temp we ask. The app turns orange when furnace comes on telling us its operating. We love it.

title: Great thermostat that really works well.
text: We have had our Sensi thermostats for 6 years. They work really well. Comforting to see the temps in our house when we are out of town. And we have a small condo unit in Santa Fe NM so it’s important, especially in the winter, to know the heat is on and working to avoid frozen pipes. Sensi was easy to install, configure, set up and control. We have 4 Sensi units.

title: Good interface, poor execution
text: sensi app requires registration of sensi unit upon connecting. when i canceled this it broke my homekit and i couldn’t connect it. Support was able to assist with an alternative method by removing my thermostat from the wall. I still was asked to register and feel product registration and phone number requirements should be removed. theres no reason a customer phone number or address should be needed. I’ve updated star rating referencing good support.

title: Perfect
text:
The Sensi was very simple to install, I just follow the instructions. The best part is that I didn’t have a C wire, and the unit was up and running without messing with the furnace control panel. It’s a winner,

The app and WiFi have a flawless connection and was easy to install. However, I do have a strong WiFi signal, 150 Mps, and an up to date router. Together everything is perfect.

title: Sensi has it all
text: Love this thermostat and the ability to control my system through the app. Thermostat has flexibility to function with multiple type systems and instructions help greatly in setting up correctly. I use this thermostat in a seasonal home and really love being able to turn the temp up or down remotely. Display is large and easy to read and understand. Great value.

title: Simple to install and operate
text: This is a great product indeed. It is quite easy to install and then later operate. We own a home in two locations so we use Sensi in both locations and can monitor temperatures in the house while we are away. Then when we are coming to one of our homes we can lower the temperature before we get there. All done via the app. It works beautifully!!

title: Great product.
text: I originally bought a Sensi because of price and the fact that you did not need a c wire. Most all other expensive thermostats needed one . I was able to follow the directions and install myself. I have it in a condo in Fl. I’m up north all summer and it works great to check if ac is keeping humidity down. Would buy again if I needed one.

title: Easy to use and set schedules
text: Easier to navigate that other thermostat control apps especially with scheduling setup. Color coding for current state of heating or cooling is a nice feature and other parameters such as fan run time per hour are easily accessible.  I have multiple Sensi thermostats and app displays them neatly on a single page for rapid access.

title: Two is better than one
text: We have two thermostat.  One at our home and one at our “get away” home.  No matter where we are we can see and control the temperature. It allows us to save money and insure the temperature is comfortable when we open the door.  They work great and the customer service is second to none.

title: Connection issues
text: I will be looking to replace my thermostat in the near future even though it’s a proximately one-year-old I must admit I am a perfectionist and it’s just annoying that my thermostat is not connected at least 50% of the time I don’t have any time in my schedule to be constantly trying to connect. My Sensi thermostat is not doing the job I expected to do when I purchased it!!

title: Humidity
text: I love this thermostat, very convenient and fun the only thing that I really don’t like is the measurement of the humidity, is not accurate at all from time to time it jumps from 52% to 58% with no reason. Since I have a humidity gadget right underneath the thermostat, I can control and I noticed that is happening regularly. Would be lovely if you guys could fix that, still it is a nice product that I really recommend.

title: Can’t delete a thermostat
text:
I don’t see his to delete a thermostat. We had a defective thermostat and had to return it. Now I can’t delete it from the app. 
 The other thermostat is fine. I suppose I could delete the entire app, then try to reconnect it but that would be a lot of work for such a basic task.

Update, I tried deleting and reloading the ap from the App Store. When I started the app after a reload, the app came up perfectly with the old, bad thermostat still there. Is there no way to start fresh?

title: Works well. Love it.
text: I’ve been using this app for at least two years. It works great. I’m able to set my thermostat from anywhere. And now I get monthly reports.  The only problem I ever have is that the thermostat Wi-Fi connects and disconnects throughout the day. So when that happens, the app cannot communicate with the thermostat. In fairness to the company, I have never called support about this issue.

title: Recently messing up
text: Was great for quite a while. But for the last several weeks, I have to continually delete the app and re-upload it for it to work and connect. Otherwise it just hangs in looking for my thermostats and not being able to find them. After delete and re-upload, works fine for maybe a day more or less. Then repeat. Only does it on my iPhone 12. No problem on my iPad

title: Network connection couldn’t be easier
text: We have tried at least 4 different programmable thermostats over the years.  Either the programming was awkward or at some point they wouldn’t connect to our network.  Routers change over time, passwords change.  The thermostat must adjust or go to the landfill.  This one has been great.  Easy and solid.

title: App needs to be fixed!
text: I have a C wire connected thermostat ST55 where the battery shows full bars all the time. I really need the backlight to stay on all the time because the thermostat is in a dark area in my home. Customer service says there is an option under display settings to keep the light on. It’s not there! I do have a Blue C wire connected and measuring 24 Volts. I removed the App and re-installed it few times. Still nothing...I will be more than happy to update the review to 5 stars if this gets fixed.

title: Great thermostat
text:
I just purchased this at Home Depot, easy to install it, easy to setting up the temperatures you want from your smart phone... 
you don’t have to get up from your couch while lying in your bed. If you feel a little cold or hot in your room just control it from your finger tips.
The price was inexpensive, I recommended.

title: Easy to use
text: This is definitely a nice app and easy to use once you just sit down and find out where all the settings are. My one complaint is that the smart alerts are sent through the email and not via a text or have the option to choose. Not everyone has their email on their phone. Definitely a nice app though ☺️.

title: Should have gone with NEST
text: I wanted to save money and purchase this thermostat, but it consistently has WiFi connection issues, no matter what I try.  Now, don’t get me wrong, the thermostat works great.  Easy to install.  But the app CONSTANTLY loses connection.  The thermostat can rarely be controlled by the app.  This is one of the features I looked forward to using, but most of the time I can’t.  Just go with the Nest if you want consistency with remote control.  My colleague has it and he says he’s never had disconnection issues.

title: Needs Minute Timer
text: If there is a way to put the air conditioning on for a certain number of minutes at a certain time, for example for on for 30 minutes at 4 PM, then turn off, I would give it a five. Everything else seems to be working great.  Install instructions were easy, iPhone app is intuitive, interoperability with HomeKit is nice. Very nice product. Just add the minute feature, and you get a five from me!

title: Great product!
text: I was a little leery of installing a web thermostat in my house but was pleasantly surprised that it has been very reliable and easy to use.  I installed it myself using the well written instruction booklet that came it.  I have no complaints whatsoever about the unit.  I kept the old manual thermostat as a backup but have not even considered using it.

title: First one of three
text: My Son gifted this to me on Fathers’ Day.  He had one since Christmas. It was installed and operational with in an hour. I plan on installing two more in our 4,000 square foot house. I especially like how it interfaces with Apple HomeKit. I did call tech support because one of my A/C units does not have a “C” wire. The phone was answered immediately and an email with written instructions on ways to solve. Thanks Emerson.

title: Holiday mode needed
text:
Overall I am pleased with the thermostats and the app. We have 8 installed and running concurrently on commercial a/c units with no issues or conflicts.

One thing on my wish list would be to have a holiday mode. My business is closed on most holidays. When a holiday falls on a normal work day I have to log in multiple times per day on multiple units and shut them down.

title: New install for my 5 year old heatpump.
text:
It was a good investment.  Bought it because of the reviews and it is Apple Home compatible. Installation went well.  I let the Thermostat run for a week or so before setting a program.   Really like how it the graph shows the run time for our compressor, heat strips, and fan.

I have recommended it to friends.

title: Sensi is a good thermostat and app
text:

title: This concept is King
text: Got this for Christmas gift, my new ac unit was installed less than a year ago  so sounded like a good idea to install this cool smart thermostat and pair them to my network. My only question to my self was, where have I  been hiding? Or I need to get out more. This thing rocks! These should be standard with new systems as well. Get it you’ll love it!  Trust me

title: Lifesaver
text: Such a great idea! My life is so much better being able to control the house fan, and temperature from another room. We needed the change to a more convenient way to manage our home. With an ill family member who needs the temp just so, we have gotten some freedom back in our lives. My husband can change features from his office so easily!

title: Emerson SenSi Thermostat
text: The installation was easy - the manual and wifi operation is flawless.  We have them in our two homes and easily track temperatures when we’re away.  We set energy saving temps when we leave and reset them to 70* from the car prior to our arrival.  Love them and would enthusiastically recommend !!

title: Mostly works, but poor UI
text:
There’s a common problem with the app where you set something and it either takes a few minutes to update, or it fails to update entirely.

IE, when you add a new schedule, sometimes you need to exit the app and come back to actually see it on the schedule selection screen.

Another example: If you tap a temperature arrow a few times, pause for a few seconds, then tap a few more times, it’ll undo the second set of taps and revert back to where you were after the first set of taps... I suspect there’s an issue of it sending a signal somewhere during your pause, waiting for feedback, then updating the UI... thus it loses what you did after the pause.

Ultimately, you can get it to do what you want, but not without some fighting with the UI.

title: Seni thermostat
text: I really appreciate the help I got from your company when I called about the problems I had with the Wi-Fi seni thermostat.  Some of the problems were my fault like wiring.  I like that I can see or manage my thermostat from my phone.  I don’t have to get up to see what temperature it is in the house; also the humidity, temperature outside.  That makes my life so much easier.

title: Seriously Great System
text:
I got this system after I returned another one not working. Thankfully they were out of the other ones so I did have to pay more for this one. 

Worth every penny. Unlike the other one the setup is in the ap. Whereas the wiring on the other one wasn’t standard with my system the Ap setup made it perfect. 

Setup was super easy. Worth every penny.

title: Frequently disconnects
text: I really like these thermostats as they are feature packed and the app is convenient and easy to use. I have 3 of them. But I hate the fact that they often go offline and cannot be controlled remotely. At some point they go online, but there is no obvious  reason for why they individually go offline/online randomly. All other remotely accessible devices used in this home (web cameras, lights, garage doors, etc...) work without this issue. Not sure I would purchase another one unless the company corrects the issue.

title: Disappointing
text: I’ve had the Sensi thermostat in my summer home for about a year.  Thought it would be nice to be able to turn on the heater/AC before I got there but that isn’t always the case.  Even when I’m in direct internet connection the sensi app doesn’t allow me to access the temperature control. It’s always a hit and miss more often a miss in connection.

title: Two ST55 Sensi Thermostats
text:
I appreciate the opportunity to state my appreciation for your product and your service staff.
The product is relatively easy to install & set up. And it functions wonderfully.
But if you do encounter a problem, their service staff is readily available and quickly/easily resolves any issues you may have.
I can’t say enough good things.
Thank You!

title: Pretty good ... still has issues
text:
We have reached that time of year in Texas where you might need heat in the morning (and maybe late night) but AC during the day. 

I've noticed that when I switch from Cool to Heat on the app and try to raise the thermostat number so the Heat will come on for a bit to take that morning chill away, the thermostat number just goes right back to where it was and I have to do it again. 
Ex: The Heat thermostat setting was at 62 this morning (but the room temp said 71 -- felt colder than 71!) 
I put it to 72 to get the Heat to come on and after a second or two, it just reverted back to 62. I had to put it to 72 again for it to turn the Heat on. 

This has happened multiple times, even when it's just on AC. I try to adjust the setting and it just reverts back to what it was. 

I do like this thermostat and the opportunity to adjust settings from my phone, but this glitch is a little annoying.

title: Convenient
text: Saves energy when you leave by adjusting the temperature up or down, whichever is best for the season. I like being able to adjust the temperature without getting out of bed or from outside when I’m gardening. The most convenient feature is not interrupting my guests when I’m entertaining. I just check my phone and control the temperature.

title: Simple and easy to use
text: I am a retired HVAC contractor and have personally sold and installed many WiFi thermostats. We now travel in the winter and I want to insure my home is not freezing. The Sensi is by far the easiest to set up and monitor. Emerson/White Rogers is one of the most reliable names in the business. A great combination of a good product and a good manufacturer.

title: Great thermostat with compatibility to non c- wire support as well
text: Liked the thermostat so much that it supports non c- wire config as it uses AA batteries for power. It worked great since a year but seeing WiFi connectivity issues since 3-4 days , not sure last update triggered this issue. Few of my friends in our community also has same type and they are seeing it as well.

title: Day group editing issues
text:
There appears to be a bug in assigning days to day groups - or it isn’t super intuitive how to make changes.

After creating a new schedule, I attempt to modify the day groups such that Friday and Saturday are on their own day group and Sunday-Thursday are on their own group.  No amount of precise tapping on the tiny day of week bubbles for either day group seems to make an impact.

I can see the temperature, can turn heating/cooling on and off, can manually change the temperature - but can’t modify day groups within a schedule.

Update: As of version 7.3.1, this issue appears to be resolved.  Thanks!

title: New install on existing system
text: Took slightly longer to install than a Nest I did few weeks ago for a friend. But comparing the cost and the excellent operating system both on the thermostat and remotely with app, Sensi is an excellent value! Works well and has intuitive control features. Two thumbs up!!

title: Used it now for 4 years
text: We got our Sensi thermostat when we purchased a new furnace 4 years ago. It’s so handy to adjust the fan and temperature at remote places with a cell phone or Ipad. We also have used it to manage our home heating and cooling while vacationing! It sure is comforting to see if our home is still warm on those cold winter days in White Lake Michigan.

title: Great thermostat interface
text: This works great for our Home in Vermont over 240 miles away. Our house is toasty when we arrive!. Also, We are able to raise and lower heat especially when we fear a power outage coming and we can at least mitigate the loss of heat affects. We are able to monitor our home’s temperature and notify our caretaker if necessary.   Great peace of mind!

title: App change requested.
text: Since I had to wipe my iPod, I'm not able to download the app any more. Can't change the thermostat from bed. Have to navigate the stairs and walk to the opposite corner of the house to change it. The iPods can't update to the latest iOS. (And it is on top of my iHome clock radio.) title: Almost 5 stars
text:
Excellent and affordable solution compared to the overpriced Nest & others

1) Auto mode can be set from the wall unit

2) Locking can be more customized, rather than all or nothing. 

For example, I’d like to lock all controls, while:

a) Allowing anyone to set target temperatures but within a limit range (which is locked)

b) Allowing anyone to set the mode to heat, cool, or auto, within the same locked limit range

Hope that makes sense and can be provided in the future.

Keep up the great work Sensi team!

title: Feedback is broken!

my system is electric heat only.  Some day I will have a heat pump and expect to take advantage of the programming features.

title: Great bang for the buck

Does everything I want. Easy to make schedules, easy to control from afar if I forget to change before I leave for the weekend etc.

title: Works great!

title: Very dependable

title: Great product

title: Go ahead and buy this!

title: Works great!

title: Wow! Easy install, easy to use!

title: IoT functionality without the creepy factor

title: Sensis
text:

title: Schedule

title: Overall The Best

title: Sensi Thermostat

text: I love the new thermostat.  It is so easy to understand and use.  However, we waited 15 hours on hold for customer service on 4 different days.  3 emails unanswered.  Would buy a different model if you want service.

title: Solid product.
text: I got the base model, non touch.  Kept disconnecting early in the setup but once I connected it, works great.  Can control from anywhere. See how this one goes then might by a second for another system we have

title: Easy install. Simple app. Love it.
text: The app and online video makes this a simple install. Plus batteries allow install without the C wire which is critical for older systems like my 30 year old unit. The phone app is nothing super fancy but it gets the job done with ease. Love it.

title: Review
text: Sensi is nice and works good as set up. I wish it had more availability of programming special options of system. Like time delays. Set backs. Off sets. Season changes. The availability of sensors for liquid and suction line and discharge air temp. With these simple options alarms could be set up to notify customers of problems coming. Those would be simple things to integrate with little cost.

title: Easy to set up, excellent support!
text: App is extremely easy to use, already saving a lot more energy than I was with my Google Nest. I really like the energy report feature as well. Took <1 min to set up with my Alexa which was a bonus.

title: Works great w Alexa
text: Got this to allow voice control with existing Alexa devices. Awesome functionality !  The Sensi app seems sluggish to accept my taps of temperature changes. But Alexa commands up and down are quick and accurate. Usage tracking also a bonus.

title: Sensi Wi-FI thermostat
text: I looked at all the smart wi-FI thermostats on the market. I did not need all the bells and whistles. Basically I just wanted to put in a schedule and remotely turn on and off. The Sensi does this and more for about half the price. I have one upstairs and one downstairs controlling different systems. One app controls either one.

title: Not working
text: I bought a new $ 4,500 furnace with a Sensi Wi-Fi a months ago. It doesn’t work. I don’t know if it is Sensi‘s problem order new furnace problem, but my furnace has work just one week. I have called the furnace man two times and Sensi four times and I still do not have a heating system

title: Flexible controlability
text: We have sensi in a house at the river in Yuma Az. When we leave home and head to the river it can be very hot inside. We set sensi via iPhone on the road and when we-arrive  its cool and ready to go. We can always check temps, change settings, turn off or on, etc. its awesome. And we self installed it!

title: Love it!
text: Initially there were definitely some bugs that caused the connection to drop repeatedly but there have been many updates that have made this a very stable and reliable app. I love how it makes it so easy to control the environment in my home from anywhere.

title: Awesome, but...
text:
It would be nice if I can have sub-accounts to give limited access to certain thermostats so employees don't have access to the entire building. 

I'm testing one now and it's great. I'd like to install 17 more in my building but would like to see restricted/limited user Acee's along with administrators access.

title: Seasonal home
text: I own a seasonal home and before purchasing my Sensi wi fi thermostat when arriving home in the brutally cold weather, we came home to a fifty degree house and would have to go out and wait for house to warm up also being able to monitor temp of house when not here is another plus.

title: Exceptional Value
text: This thermostat/controller is extraordinary for the cost. I can control from my cellphone, it’s accurate and there is an immediate response from the HVAC system. Easy to install, good installation instructions took me 15 minutes to replace a 20 year old for this one.

title: Awesome app
text: This app has saved us so much time it is so convenient to control our business with this app no more worries of employees playing with the temperature leaving it on after business hours I will advise every business owner must have you truly need it it really works!!!

title: Great Overall
text: Overall the layout and functionality of the app is spot on and easy to use. I love the fact that I can control the comfort and efficiency of my heating and cooling in my home while away with the confidence the app and thermostat running smoothly. The only thing I wish this app had was a control widget for the widget screen.

title: Which bugs are being fixed?
text: I see updates for this app but the same bugs are still here. I have to try 10 different times just to change the temp. The software used to be good but is proving to be unreliable, lately.

title: Good value, no watch app.
text:
I like the value of this thermostat compared to many other WiFi units that cost much more. 

My sensi was loosing it’s WiFi connection to my NetGear router intermittently.  I bought a new ASUS router and now my Sensi WiFi connection is 100% reliable. 

There is not any Apple Watch app - that would be a nice feature.

I like being able to control Sensi via Google assistant. Except when I ask assistant “what temperature is it in living room?”, the answer I get back is always off by a degree.  

There is no history graph or data available. I can’t see how long my AC was running today or how many times it turned on.

title: WiFi Issues
text: I just installed my new Sensi Touch thermostat and it was working great for the first hour, then when I started setting up programs in it I lost signal with thermostat. Then I when through settings it came back and then off again? Is this what I need to expect out of this product if so I will be returning it. I contacted the email help which says 7 days a week but it’s been a couple hours and I haven’t heard anything yet, so that isn’t much help either. Guess I should have went with a nest.

title: Cabin Thermostat
text: Love, love, love this thermostat and app!!!  I can monitor my cabin and see if we have any trouble and react quickly if needed. Also, when I leave my house to go North, I can adjust the temps so when I arrive, it’s nice and warm or cool and no waiting for that to happen!  Great addition!

title: Fair could be simpler.
text: Very good thermostat. The app could be better but the thermostat is good value for money, definitely does the work like other fancy expensive ones as ‘nest’. If I would rate the thermostat that would be 4.5 (and I still have one of the very first models, for years now). The app still needs to improve, mostly around simplicity.

title: Good app but needs an enhancement
text: I would like to see a button on the home screen to toggle the furnace on and off. In my case I don’t leave it on all the time and it steps I shouldn’t have to take to turn it on and off.

title: VERY FRUSTRATING
text: This unit is not worthy of 1 star. The schedule is set to 68 but the temp is 60. The furnace starts, runs for 30 seconds then stops. It starts 30 seconds later and then stops. This pattern happens several times every morning and evening. When we override the schedule a few degrees, it takes an hour for the furnace to register the override. I want to return this thermostat, but don’t know how cause we purchased it from our local electric company via a energy rebate.

title: Thermostat
text: Omg we love it we have been able to heat the house up before coming home and we have full access through our cellphone for heat and air conditioning the weather you name it and the installation was quite simple.

title: WiFi connection
text: Lost connection with WiFi. Everything else in home connected ie; security cameras. Happens frequently and since is a second home I can’t troubleshoot or change temperature setting from 900 miles away. Very costly and frustrating!

title: Works Great!
text: I can control everything on our HVAC unit at our lake house, from my phone. We live over two hours away. I simply use the app to turn on the heat or A/C and have the house at the right temperature when we get there. Also like that it tells you the humidity in the house and the outside temperature. This is very nice and handy to have.

title: App Constantly offline
text: The connection with WiFi lasts less than 12 hours- I then have to reestablish this is a problem since I bought the thermostat to monitor a thermostat in an apartment- so... I can see the heat was turned up to 78° but I can’t control it from my phone.

title: Easy install - great support
text: Have put two sensi touch thermostats to replace old two wire heating stats.  Emerson’s excellent online problem solving support helped me figure out how to add 24 vac C wire.  Their thoughtful built in debug got my stats connected to our network and controlled via HomeKit.  Both stats now accessed via Siri.  Thanks, Emerson.

title: Good affordable thermostat
text: Just what I needed, easy to install and set up. Works great for my shore house. We have used this thermostat for two years and haven’t have any issues. We change the temperature three hours before we get down and house is at set temperature. Really love that on cold days.

title: An excellent buy
text: It is easy to setup and operate.  Works exceptionally well.  Like the battery power supply, rather than tampering with the solid-state control board in the furnace.  Batteries are simple and inexpensive to replace. Control boards are expensive.  It’s a no-brained. There are minor issues with the geo-fence, but that is the beta version.

title: Useless device
text: I have discovered that this cheap piece of junk has no provision to reconnect to the router if the connection is interrupted even for a few moments. Despite having a pair of batteries in it you have to completely re-enter the pin and all passwords every time. So if you are not at home you have no way to reconnect. Every other internet capable item I have no matter how inexpensive automatically reconnects except for this albatross of a device. Will be returning it and buying something form someone besides Emerson.

title: Best Mother’s Day Present Yet!
text: I have arthritis and some time it’s hard to get up and down. The smart thermostat is a blessing. It sure saves wear and tear on the body. When I’m away and the weather changes suddenly, I can control it from my phone.

title: Reliable
text: I have two Sensi thermostats in my main home and one in my vacation home.  They work great when I am out of town or don’t want to get out of the recliner.  The display tells me local temperature outside and humidity inside the house.

title: Easy to set up and good interface
text: The instructions to set up thermostat and app were well written and easy to follow. No issues with connectivity or control. Would definitely recommend.

title: Won’t config WiFi on model up500w
text: I know it’s an old model of this thermostat, but this update of the app simply won’t configure the WiFi on the thermostat. I e tried it a million times.  After you enter the WiFi password it just jumps over the “configuring WiFi”step and jumps over to your home ssid.  Please fix with an update so I can connect this to my network.  Past versions worked just fine.

title: Super device and value !!
text: Easy to install and operate, this will amortize pretty fast. While going out we set the temperature 5 to 6 degrees higher and on the way home back to normal. With a driving time of about 20 min it feels fresh at arrival

title: Waste of money
text:
The sensi controller continues to fail to shut the HVAC system off when it reaches the set temperature.  I have to flip the breaker in the main electrical panel in order to shut the system off.  I have tried resetting the unit and  changing the operating settings.   Nothing works.  

Costumer service is non-responsive.  Absolutely no help!

The controller interface is not user friendly and app is difficult to navigate.  I don’t recommend purchasing this system.

title: Cabin on the lake
text: After researching many thermostats and considering price and what i needed, I chose Sensi.  It works great to check and control a lig cabin an hour away in Maine where temperature drops below zero for months.  If loss of wi fi it always reconnects.  I have 4 on the same app.  It shows outside temp and hi and low for the day.  Very pleased.

title: Connection issues
text: Somehow, whenever I need the app the most, it ALWAYS seems to be offline, and there's no way to make it come back online until it decides it's ready. Most of the time I just end up stopping whatever I'm doing and walking over and making a manual adjustment. I've been using this app for the last 4 years and have not seen any improvement to this issue. What's the point of having a connected device if it's never connected? Next house I'm getting a Nest.

title: Remote Home
text: The best $ I have ever spent. Controlling a second home. Security knowing when we have freezing temps we can control and view the status. When we visit we can set the temp to be comfortable when we arrive. I Plan on purchasing an additional one. Great  great gift for a friend.

title: A Thermostat, you have total control
text:
Best value, best features, WiFi controllability,
Flexible schedules, away from home control, runs circles around other Wifi thermostats we have used in the past, and simple to install. !!!!!!

title: Still not a landscape view?
text: Why after many updates won't this app display in landscape mode? I use an iPad mounted semi-permanently in landscape orientation. When I do use this app , it throws every other app into portarit mode and seems to interfere with other apps returing to landscape mode. In every other rrespect, the app is pretty solid and does what I want. Not having an option to use this in landscape mode is very  weird and and an odd oversight by the app developer.

title: Could do more
text:
Reasonable interface for programming the thermostat, although a bit clunky until you get the hang of it. Save your work!

I can *control* the furnace fan (On vs Auto) from the app, but sadly, even with my relatively new model of thermostat, I cannot *program* the fan to be on during certain time periods (like overnight).  Maybe someday, eh?

title: Latest upgrade, step backwards
text:
On my I-Pad, now when I open the app, the screen with temperatures is only as big as if it were on a cell phone.  Why would that be helpful?  The previous version had the whole screen being utilized without having to click on the Fan word first.  
I reached out to tech support and they offered no solution to the newer version sucking.  Smaller #’s isn’t what Anybody would want to see!!

title: Not correct
text:
Some thing is not right after the update released on 10/30.
Thermostat shows heat is not running but phone app shows heating (furnace) is running..
Why such an anomaly?
When I checked the vent heat was indeed running.

title: Easy to use
text: The set up and functions of the thermostat were very simple and easy to use.  No problem connecting.  Has many great features and gives you complete control right from your smartphone. Excellent choice for a Vacation property.

title: Poor customer support
text:
I do not accept that Sensi gathers data from my home and refuses to allow me to do the same. I want to capture my HVAC usage and not have Sensi let me have it at their behest.
Repeated requests from Support has led nowhere. I regret purchasing this item that someone gathers its data. You can’t turn off them stealing my data.

title: Good remote app but needs more functions
text: I like the app and is simple to use. However it could use a hold temperature feature so we don’t have to use programs for all settings. I would also like to know details on run time and filter condition

title: Sensi app
text: Sensi app works well but did have trouble getting it connected to my IPhone. A message window would open to say it’s not compatible with my router but getting support on it solved the problem and it’s does what I want it to do for now. Just turn on and off my heat.

title: Sully
text: We have the 4 wire configuration and the app combined with the thermostat work perfectly. We can easily check the temperature during winter to see that the furnace is working. It is easy to adjust the temperature remotely and you can see the local weather within the app. 5 Star!

title: So frustrating
text: It’s probably the piece of sh&t thermostat that I’m frustrated with and not necessarily the app, but whatever the reason, this just isn’t working for me. I’m sitting here a dozen feet from the thermostat and the app says we’re online - which is unusual for this crappy setup - and it hasn’t changed the setting that I’ve requested. Every other device in the house has no problem maintaining a constant connection to wifi, but this crappy system is offline more than it’s connected.

title: Bedtime
text: Love being able to check the thermostat from bed to see if someone in the household has change the temperature from the scheduled temp. I can change it back without anyone knowing,

title: Great thermostat and OTA Updates
text: I really liked this thermostat app when we had it installed with new system. And then it got even better with updates and new features! I’ve had it for 2 years now.

title: So far this is terrible
text: I have had this thermostat installed two weeks and it has never stayed connected to my WiFi linger than a day!  The instructions to reconnect don’t seem to apply to my problem. I wouldn’t recommend this

title: WiFi and App control is glitchy
text: The app is not updating changes I’ve made on multiple occasions to the heating schedule. It’s disappointing because the efficiency of setting up and maintaining a daily schedule on my phone was one of the key selling points. The WiFi often disconnects as well. So make sure when you set up the schedules, it’s exactly what you want as you might have a hard time changing it later.

title: Awesome!
text: I love this app and have never had a problem with it. When I’m traveling and forget to turn off the air or lower the heat I can do it easily from anywhere. When I want to come home to a warm or cool home I just log in and turn on the heat or air from anywhere!

title: Way better than the Nest
text: I had a Nest, then I moved and got this thermostat. The Sensi is a million times better than the Nest! More control over everything and a better User interface by far. Very reliable.

title: Simple improvements
text: When I reach for my phone at 5:30 in the morning to look at this app, it’s because I’m uncomfortable and want to change the temperature. The current temperature is in giant font. I need to know where the heat and cool buttons are and what temperature I’m adjusting to, which all are in very tiny font. Why are all apps designed for people with perfect eyesight. Now I’m fumbling for my glasses.

title: Always disconnected
text: When I first installed Sensi I was so excited compared to the older model I had that wasn’t on line. I find myself on this app all the time trying to reset due to offline issues and of course never works. Also it burns batteries like crazy, in all the 7years I leave in my house I change the battery once to my old thermostat but with Sensi I changed (not cheap batteries) 2-3 times for the year. How does this help?

title: Just Works
text: Just works!  Simple installation, clear user interface, not a lot of bells, flags and whistles which is why is works so reliably.  Have it installed in vacation home so adjusting temp prior to arrival is a snap.  Provides useful utility usage information.

title: What a convenience!
text: Who woulda thot a 67-year-old would cotton to a phone to change the thermostat?!  Our house has such different needs depending on which floor you’re on (split level), it’s such a relief to just reach for my phone to get the temp just right for any given situation.

title: Schedule is broken
text:
When you add or edit a schedule the behavior is completely random.  Sometimes is saving the changes. Sometimes not. Sometimes there is a schedule but is different from what you just edited. The feature is unusable. They could add a save button. 
The latest update broke also the day groups. Cannot add a day in a new group. Software quality is definitely an issue

title: Change Password Screen
text: Change password screen popped up the other day with no way to use a “forgot my password” functionality. Can’t get past this screen and have been unable to control the thermostat using the app for several days now. I’ve had this app for 5 years and haven’t had a problem. Now all of a sudden it’s useless!

title: This is the one!
text:
I first purchased a Honeywell thermostat that required a C wire. 
When I called their helpline they were no help. Gave me misinformation and tried to sell me a more expensive thermostat!
The Sensi on the other hand was simple to install, simple to use both on site and remotely and works like a dream!

title: Mostly happy.
text:
I bought two of the Alexa controlled thermostats. The one downstairs works just fine but the upstairs unit is offline a couple of times a week. I have a WiFi booster less than three feet from it so signal strength is not the issue. 

If Alexa is able to switch modes from cooling to heat, I have not yet discovered how.

title: Love Our Sensi App!
text: We have two Sensi thermostats and this app handles them perfectly. Love the flexibility and options it provides for controlling everything! You can set up individual days or groups of similar ones. Great compatibility with Apple HomeKit! Highly recommend this app!

title: App won’t connect to Sensi
text:
Spent literally 3.5 hours tonight standing in front of my thermostat trying to get it to add and connect to the iOS app.  Changed the SSID on my router and apparently this is the end of the world for the Sensi.  No matter what I did, the app failed to re-add.  Tried calling Emerson support phone on their website and get a number disconnected signal.  Professional...

I loved this thermostat until today.  Now I’m frustrated beyond measure.  Why is reconnecting to the network so difficult for this stupid thermostat to handle???

—-

Support just responded through App Store.  3 months later... I’ve moved on at this point.  The problem is that the thermostat does not support the newest standards of 2.4ghz.  I had to set my router to “legacy” connection to be able to connect to Sensi.  Ridiculous.

title: Love it!!
text: I am wheelchair bound and unable to reach the wall thermostat so unless someone else was around I never could keep the temperature to my liking, but since getting my Sensi thermostat with the app on my phone I am able to take back control of my room temperature!!😃

title: On line disrupt
text: When I need it more like in the middle of the night, the App is Offline and I have to close it and open many times until goes On line again to be able to change temperature

title: Perfect
text:
A no-brained to install and program.  Coming home earlier than expected?  Not a problem to change the temp on your smart phone on the way or from the warmth of your bed on a cold morning.

This is truly a science fiction leap from banking a fire or starting a fire for breakfast.

title: Programming
text: Could use written instructions on the programming procedures. There was none in the box that I have. I should not have to call tech support for that kind of help but trial and error and maybe a call to support just to see if I missed anything.

title: Should have went with nest!!
text: Sensi has way to many “Server issues”  and even though they say it will follow schedule when this happens it does not. In the winter we put on layers but the Summers in Texas are brutal and their server issues that can go on for days are life threatening.

title: Happy Customer
text: It’s been 6 months since installation and i couldn’t be happier.  True I don’t use all the functions available but does everything I require and does it well.

title: Works well
text: Overall it works very well. If you change passwords or get a new modem, it is a real challenge to reprogram it. It generally takes me at least 3 tries. It should be much easier.

title: So convenient
text: It’s great, especially since my dad since has a problem walking and can just control it on the phone.  Runs smoothly, no glitch at all

title: Everyone love it
text: Well now we have a very easy to use product every one has downloaded the app and control the thermostat to everyone likeness Sensi is the best my 81 year old mother love it easy to use for her young mind thanks

title: Yes
text: I love Sensi. The only drawback is the fact it is off line too often. I control a townhouse in Florida and I sometime have to look multiple times to be able to see the temperature and humidity. Other than that it is a very good thermostat. I recommend it .

title: Good but needs improvement
text: Geofencing is in beta when other thermostats have it in place. Current geofence lowers temp when leaving but doesn’t increase heat when returning? This is a major flaw. Thermostat doesn’t have a learning mode to determine users temperatures.

title: Sensi Thermometer
text: Occasionally the connection between my iPhone and the thermometer stops working.  After a day or two it resumes operation without any action on my part.  My other WiFi devices, however, continue to work.  Otherwise the thermometer works very well and always can be adjusted manually.

title: Good WiFi thermostat
text: It does the job well, but is a very basic thermostat.  It really needs more programable cycles for my taste.  Such as a vacation mode and possibly a special weekend Mode.  But at least you can manually adjust it through WiFi for those occasions.

title: Humidifier
text: The thermostat is fine with the exception of wiring in the humidifier control, after calling customer service and being on hold for 40 minutes then being told you all couldn’t help me I was pretty disappointed and to contact my local havac company, needless to say it’s half installed in the dead of winter. Not happy.

title: So unintuitive and frustrating app
text:
What the hell does one do with the auto temperature settings when using a heating only system?
Everything has to be painfully researched, as their online manuals are lite weight.  Apple would never an app with such a confusing interface display.  
Ain’t worth the headache.  Sending it back.

title: Snowbird
text:
Works GREAT for our applications. Being snowbirds we are able to check the status of our Florida and Michigan home while away. We can set the Sensi from our phone and it is comfortable when we arrive.
Highly recommended.

title: Spot on
text: Easy to connect to internet network and features not offered in other brands. Only one I would use tried all the others!

title: Worth every penny.
text: Love the fact that it regulates the temperature when we’re away from the house and helps with the energy cost. Seen a significant difference in my energy bill.

title: Excellent Product
text: Our Sensi thermostat has been just excellent. It was very easy to install and easy to connect to my phone.  Thank you for making a wonderful product  !

title: Cannot change days
text: Just installed. Works fine manually and for the same schedule 7 days in a row, but the cannot create anything custom with different schedules for different days of the week. As my work schedule varies every week, this is a huge flaw. I hope it's just a bug that will be fixed in the next update.

title: Worked good at first.....
text: Worked ok for the first month.  Now it constantly says not connected even when the thermostat says it is connected. Also when I change the temperature from the app, nothing happened.....

title: Never works
text:
I don’t know why my thermostat needs to talk to some branded cloud thing, but it does. I’m guessing someone decided they need all my personal data to improve their profit margins.

I’d be ok with this if it actuall worked, but this thermostat and app fail more often than they work. Sometimes I try pinging the sensi cloud address and it’s down completely for hours on end, other times it appears to be up but the thermostat still doesn’t work.

What this means is the app is broken all the time, and the thermostat only works if you walk up to it and set the temp manually.

Support ignores tickets for months, then closes them saying there is no problem with their cloud service.

Avoid. Return the thermostat if you find yourself needing this terrible app.

title: Excellent WiFi thermostat!
text: I love this Thermostat!! I can control anywhere and at anytime! Tells me usage and humidity each day and Month! Highly recommend this for everyone! I have 2 Zones, so I have 2 of these!

title: Awesome WiFi thermostat
text: The app is extremely easy to use. I have had the thermostat installed for about a year and have had absolutely no issues. I highly recommend the unit.

title: a MUST HAVE!
text:
If you want to save money on your electric bill and have the convenience of controlling the temperature in your home with alexa or your phone....you MUST GET THIS product ASAP!
Most definitely a 5 star product!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Two years in, still works great!
text: No reason to spend extra $ buying a nest, which I use at my work. This is very easy to understand and install and works very similarly.

title: Can't get a hold of customer care
text: System was installed by a licensed professional. Fan won't shut off when the system is completely off and it never goes to the temperature I set. It does whatever it wants.

title: For convenience sake
text: I love the panel touch screen, but I adore the iPhone feature. At home- away from home- it doesn’t matter. Temperature control is at my fingertips. What’s the temp in my home? What’s the thermostat reading? I can finish my dinner while checking my phone. Love it.

title: Sensi
text: I have been running sensi for 4 years and it has helped control the temperature in my home. I am able to log in from the app from anywhere and adjust the settings to save on utilities. It was easy to set up and wire for a novice electrician.

title: Always works.
text: I like it a lot. It comes in handy when controlling my thermostat away from home. I wish and hope they come out with an app for the Apple Watch. That would be awesome.

title: Sensi thermostat
text: This is an awesome device. We can’t complain about anything. Easy to install and very user friendly! Would definitely recommend to everyone!

title: Awesome app, simple to use
text: Great app to control the ac from home. I travel and it is nice to be able to turn it down on my way home.  Saves cash and is simple to change. Also showed me how to save a $$ with the electric company. Far better then nest.

title: Very easy install
text: This product works exactly like they mention very easy to install. The holes lined up perfectly with my old thermostat. Immediately got sent a text message from my utility company for $25 rebate if I submitted to A plan  they provided.

title: Love!
text:
We are retired and being able to control our system via our phones is lazy but GREAT! 
I like being able to remotely control our system. We can come home to a toasty house without the heat running all day.

title: Not as user friendly
text: The WiFi part is not as consistent and I have to reconnect too many times for me. It’s just a pain. I like the feature of  having multiple schedules to select from.

title: Great Product
text: Out of the box and WiFi setup in five minutes a piece x 18 units. Scrolled through the app turned up the heat and all are good. Response time to temp change is wicked fast. The only thing I’m miss is a locking feature then they would be perfect.

title: New network set up
text: I spoke with technical support in the Philippines for new network setup. She understood the issues and carefully walked me step by step for the new network installation. Absolutely wonderful and quick

title: Sensi Offline
text: Steps to take when Sensi status is “Offline” are unclear, therefore extremely aggravating. I get an error message “Need Help? Click here”. When I click as indicated, it takes me to a message saying that the information is no longer available. I am stuck in an “ offline” status st a time when exterior temperatures are pushing to 96 deg F today.

title: Won’t follow schedule
text: Everything works fine except the most important part: the schedule. I have two thermostats and neither one will follow the schedule as I set it. Overnight, I set the bedroom’s AC to 72° and will wake up in the middle of the night to the thermostat set to 77°. And not one of the settings on the schedule is 77°, so why it picks 77°, I have no idea. Frustrating and disappointing.

title: Love it
text: Easy to use, set up was incredibly simple. It literally walks you through the process. Had this for almost a year now with no complaints.

title: Easier to use than my older version of Next
text: I really enjoy how user friendly this is. Easy to program, work with  and safe money.

title: Digital thermostat and
text: I am so impressed with this system. User friendly, accurate, stress free. If you are a traveler, this is for you. You can control your home wherever you go , 24/7.  Love that assurance.

text: This thermostat works.  It lacks features in the scheduling and the minimum temperature. The lowest you can set the heat is 50 and if you try and schedule the heat to turn on for a period of time I’d like it to be turned off at some point too. I’m not the target audience requesting these features and I get that.
